results.description:
>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.


AWARD-WINNING SOMMELIER JEAN-LUC LE DÛ TAKES OUT PROFESSIONALS ON A TASTINGS TOUR OF FRENCH WINE REGIONS.

On Tuesday, May 24, Out Professionals welcomes Members and friends to Le Dû’s Wines, the West Village wine shop rated Number One in New York City by Zagat. At this month’s edition of the new Out Professionals Wine Club, the shop’s founder, James Beard Award-winning sommelier Jean-Luc Le Dû, takes members on a tour of the wine regions of France.

The journey begins with a glass of Champagne Doyard “Cuvee Vendemiare” NV.

Commentary then accompanies generous tastings of six distinctive wines, each showcasing the unique qualities of a particular wine region.

French Whites:
Loire-Muscadet “Les Gras Moutons”, Domaine de la Pepiere 2014
Chablis « Terroirs de Chablis », Patrick Piuze 2014

French Reds:
Beaujolais « Le Cambon », Château Cambon 2011
Gevrey Chambertin « Terres Blanches », Charlopin 2013
Chateauneuf du Pape, Domaine du Vieux Lazaret 2012
Bordeaux-Medoc, Château d’Escurac 2009

Each wine is paired with cheese and charcuterie from Murray’s Cheese Shop, a Village favorite for 75 years. The evening is designed to offer ample time for relaxed networking with other Out Professionals Members and guests.

WHERE
Le Dû’s Wines, 600 Washington Street, between Morton and Leroy Streets in the West Village. Subway: A/C/E, B/D/F/M to West 4th Street; 1 to Houston Street; PATH to Christopher Street.

WHAT’S UP
Doors open at 6:30 p.m. for a welcoming glass of Champagne. From 7:00 to 8:45 p.m., tastings and commentary on six wine pairings. Attendees enjoy a 5% percent discount on individual bottles, 15% on a case. 

ADMISSION
Nonmember, $70. Dues-paying OP Member, $55. Space limited; best to register in advance. Pre-registration closes at noon on Monday, May 23. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks!

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!
A 12-month Individual Out Professionals Membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission for one to tonight’s edition of OP’s Wine Club, just $110. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing! Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Tour France Through Wine!

Building on what we learned last month, we'll go through a simple WordPress install, talk more about settings, and discuss how to use widgets. 6:30-6:45 Networking

Our Speaker 

Laura Hartwig is a WordPress Developer for the MarkNet Group and one of the co-organizers of this meetup group. She's spoken at several meetups and WordCamps. She has written articles for TutsPlus.com and you can find quite a few of her tutorials online at www.youtube.com/user/LauraHartwig.

results.description: Book Description: Getting Stoned with Savages tells the hilarious story of Troost’s time on Vanuatu—a rugged cluster of islands where the natives gorge themselves on kava and are still known to “eat the man.” Falling into one amusing misadventure after another, Troost struggles against typhoons, earthquakes, and giant centipedes and soon finds himself swept up in the laid-back, clothing-optional lifestyle of the islanders. When Sylvia gets pregnant, they decamp for slightly-more-civilized Fiji, a fallen paradise where the local chiefs can be found watching rugby in the house next door. And as they contend with new parenthood in a country rife with prostitutes and government coups, their son begins to take quite naturally to island living—in complete contrast to his dad.
results.name: Getting Stoned with Savages by J. Maarten Troost

results.description:
This week I am going to see The Nice Guys I will arrive at 6:45 for the 7:15 pm showing. I  have seat D6 If you are coming post your seat #  If anyone wants to go to the Red Oak Diner after the movie meetup again in the lobby after the show.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: assinged seats
results.name: $5.50 Movie Night- The Nice Guys

results.description:
Pay No Mind

Chan/Zen Meditation Session - led by David Listen

Cultivating mindfulness and skillful mindlessness in a 2 hour session of meditation. Includes sitting, exercise, and a talk, followed by Q & A if time permits.

The meditation session will take place in a classroom setting therefore people will be practicing in chairs.  You are welcome to bring yoga mats or towels if you like to sit on the floor.

David Listen, who received formal Zen monastic training and was previously a director for a Zen retreat center for over six years, had been teaching meditation for over ten years throughout the US, EU, and E Asia.


Please join us at in the Lower East Side of Manhattan.  This is a free event. 

How and Where to Meet: The exact location of this event will be provided to those who RSVP.   The seating is first come first serve so please come by 6:30pm and the session will begin promptly at 6:45pm.  Hope to see you there.

_/|\_,

- Eddie

More detailed Bio  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -  -


David Listen, born and raised on Long Island, New York, is one of the few people to serve as monastic disciple of late Chan/Zen Master Sheng Yen and received his monastic education at Dharma Drum Mountain World Center for Buddhist Education.  David has been studying and teaching Zen/Chan Buddhist practice, including intensive meditation retreats for over ten years throughout the US, Europe, and East Asia.  

Previously known as Venerable Chang Wen, he had been a monk for over a decade, living Buddhism's way of life within the structure and discipline of a monastic community.  During that period he served for six years as the director of Dharma Drum Retreat Center in Upstate NY.  Now he is following his own creative direction and returned to laity to continue to share the wisdom and compassion of the Buddha's teaching in a more engaged way.

He currently lectures, leads meditation retreats, writes articles, translates Chinese Buddhist texts, and composes meditative music.  His current profession is life mentoring/coaching practice.  David holds a Bachelor's Degree of Science from the SUNY College of Environmental Science and Forestry.  He is fluent in Mandarin Chinese.


Relevant Links

https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-kabacinski-359469106

http://theseventhwave.co/looking-for-the-buddha/


http://davidlisten.com
results.name: Meditation Class - Pay No Mind: Zen Teacher David Listen (Free)

Become the best damn hypnotist you can – Tuesday night* Practice Group

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues May 12th and 26th for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Each meeting will focus on something new or in need of practice so we can improve our skills and expand our range. We’ll watch videos of Milton Erickson in action and take the time to dissect them and really learn from them. You’ll learn and share new techniques. We’ll swap scripts. We’ll swap books and other media. Above all, we’ll PRACTICE and get GOOD.

One benefit you get from attending is the group support of learning. Last time we met we watched a couple of hours of a newly available DVD set called “In the Room with Milton Erickson.” It’s how Erickson taught Ericksonian Hypnosis. Up to maybe a dozen people would squeeze into his office and listen to him speak and watch him do demos. Now YOU can be in that room too. It’s pretty amazing, really, and SO instructive. I love it.

AND – it’s only $20 a night! (Amazing deal.)

Open to graduates of Doug’s NLP or Hypnosis trainings or students who have received similar training from other reputable training centers.

TUESDAY evening, May 12th

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY so we can start at 7:00


CLICK HERE - ONLY $20 (via PayPal)

Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
</a><a href="http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com/">http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
– Jackie

"Best Meet-up ever.”
– Kate

“Your Trance Night was a wonderful respite from the world. It was like a vacation from all of the stresses of every day life, a vacation for my soul. It continues to ripple though me today. So glad I came.”

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
Abstract:

We will present some recent progress on Apache Flink's machine learning library, focusing on a new implementation of the k-nearest neighbors (knn) algorithm for Flink.  In the spirit of the Kappa Architecture, Apache Flink is a distributed batch and stream processing tool that treats batch as a special case of stream processing.  We will discuss a few ways, both exact and approximate, to do distributed knn queries, focusing on using quadtrees to spatially partition the training set and using z-value based hashing to reduce dimensionality.

Bio:

Dan Blazevski loves distributed computing.  He has prior academic/lab work experience at ETH Zurich and Oak Ridge National Laboratory in computational physics and engineering after completing his PhD in Mathematics from UT Austin.  Although he still occasionally misses the good 'ol days of Fortran and MPI, he's pretty excited to have made the transition to industry as a Data Engineering Insight Fellow in 2015 where he started working on Flink, and now helps lead the Fellows program in NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: Check in with security from the 18th Street entrance
results.name: KNN with Apache Flink by the Implementor, Dan Blazevski

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.
results.how_to_find_us: We’re on the second floor of the building in the far end
results.name: Tech Tuesday Open House at Hack Manhattan

venue.name: Shambhala Meditation Center Of New York

results.description:
What is your secret personal paradox? We all have one, or two, or twenty. Mostly we spend our lives trying to avoid, resolve, or transmute our paradoxes. We assume the ideal life is devoid of contradiction and hypocrisy, and might even make fun of others whose personal paradox is on display. What if we considered our contradictions as sacred – our own life as a koan to be contemplated, appreciated, and cherished as the way forward.

The Weekly Dharma Gathering is a perfect introduction to the Shambhala teachings and mindfulness meditation, as well as an opportunity to connect with other practitioners. It consists of group meditation practice, a talk by one of our senior teachers, discussion, and a light reception. Meditation instruction is also provided.

This open house is an opportunity to meditate in a supportive group setting, to learn about how to apply the principles of meditation to everyday life, and to meet and mingle with fellow New Yorkers interested in mindfulness. Bring your friends!

More program Information: http://ny.shambhala.org/program-details/?id=263875

David Perrin is a teacher and meditation instructor. He is a practicing drama therapist, currently working with young adults, and a father of three children.
results.name: Open House Dharma Gathering with David Perrin: Personal Paradox as Path

results.description:
For the May 2016 StoryCode NYC Forum we are thrilled to welcome the immersive theater innovators from Wolf349 (Michael Rau, Asa Wember and Michael Yates Crowley). The team will present TEMPING, a performance created anew each time for an audience of one. The strange story of a company at the edge of the recession, TEMPING is performed for one new employee at a time by computer, laser printer, voicemail, and Microsoft Excel.

TEMPING is a theatrical adaptation of the mortality tables used by insurance companies to calculate how long people will live. These tables are commonly used in many industries, although most people will never see them. We start with the idea, what if your job was to update these tables? What if you saw your own number?

ABOUT MICHAEL RAU

Michael Rau (USA,) is an artist working at the intersection between live performance and digital technology. His most recent project was TEMPING, an immersive digital experience which premiered last fall at the 53 New York Film Festival at Lincoln Center. Other notable work includes, “Absent” an interactive walking tour of an abandoned subway tunnel in Cleveland Ohio, which was awarded “best-of-fest” at the Ingenuity Festival. These two storytelling experiences were for solo audience members and blurred the lines between art, theater and interactive game. As a professional director, he directs operas and plays in New York City, and Europe. In NYC, his work has seen at The Public Theater, PS 122, the Bushwick Starr, and Ars Nova. Regionally his work has been performed at the American Repertory Theater, and Opera Santa Barbara He has taught at NYU, Wesleyan University, and Columbia University, and has created developed new work with New York Theater Workshop, the O’Neill Playwrights Conference and The Kennedy Center. He most recently served as the associate director for David Bowie’s music-theater piece Lazarus.
results.name: Wolf359 Present TEMPING

Hi All!

We have an exciting new event planned on May 24th at the Samsung Accelerator.

Join us for an evening of engaging conversations involving prominent members of New York's wearable tech community. We'll learn how wearables will continue to develop in the next few years beyond a market currently dominated by step trackers and smartwatches.

Panelists include:

• Nora Levinson, President & CEO at Caeden (a design-driven wearable technology company)


• Ryan Shearman, Founder & CEO at Fusar (creating an ecosystem of smart helmet products)


• Meisha Brooks, Product Manager/Mechanical Engineer at The Crated (inventing solutions to help companies combine technology and apparel)


Moderated by:

• Sumeet Shah, Senior Associate at Brand Foundry Ventures (early stage VC firm focused on consumer brands and connected devices including wearables)

Schedule for the evening:

7:00PM to 7:30PM - Networking

7:30PM to 8:15PM - Panel session + audience Q&A

8:15PM to 8:45PM - More networking

Pizza and drinks will be served!

Thanks,


-Aashay & Amish

Wearable Tech NYC Organizer Keynotes at Wearable Tech Expo NYC

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

See the Highline in a totally different way with the spring cutback which exposes a lot of what is covered during the summer also if it is a clear night you can peer through the telescopes of the Amateur Astronomers Association and see the stars and planets! 

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day! 

The Highline is New York’s most popular attraction! The Highline is an elevated freight train trestle that operated in NYC from the 1930’s to the 1980’s. After years of neglect The Friends of The Highline have saved the structure and transformed it into a beautiful park featuring many of the elements from its’ rich history! Your tour guide will share the history of the highline and the surrounding neighborhoods and show you amazing photo’s from before the trestle was built, while it was in operation and what it looked like while abandoned.

Join us for a fun evening of socializing and learning.  Following the tour, the group will go out for food and drinks. $15 includes the tour only. 

(PLEASE PAY THE $15 WHEN YOU ARRIVE & BE SURE TO BRING EXACT CHANGE)

What to Wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: A camera, a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

What to Expect: 10-20 fun and friendly people who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city.

The group will meet at The Death Avenue Cafe at[masked]th avenue at 28th street between 6:30pm-7pm.  Come closer to 6:30 if you want food or drink.  We will end at Gansevoort Street.
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Highline Sunset and Stargazing History Tour/Happy Hour

Your chance to learn how to Dance Tango is FINALLY here! (And to have Fun & make friends!) 

Bring your partner or just come by yourself.

This is an introductory Tango course to learn the basics so you get a good taste of it. Come with good energy to Have Fun & Make Friends!

When: TUESDAYS

Time: 7:00 to 8:00 pm (60 minutes class). Then, we go out for drinks!

Location: Adelante Studios: 25 W 31st street, New York, NY  (Lots of trains, even the Path)

Price for the course: 

Drop-in: $35 at the door (per hour, per person).

Month: $100 for 4 consecutive weeks ($25/class). <--- Best option.


Write me if you have questions.

Best,

Laura :-D

-------------------------------------

Where Are The Classes Taught?

Adelante Studios: 

25 W 31st street
New York, NY 10001
(Lots of trains, even the Path). 2nd Floor, studio 1.


How Do I Get There?

Lots of trains and buses near by. Even the PATH if you live in NJ. 

What Should I Wear?

Wear comfortable clothing (except pajamas :-D). Women can bring something sexy if they wish and shoes that slide easily with a closed heel like strap or full heel (no sandals neither flip-flops type)

Men need also shoes that slide easily. You should not wear any shoes with rubber soles. Almost anything but sneakers.


HOPE YOU CAN JOIN US! 
Cheers,

Laura


. 
PS1: Get a gift certificate for your brother, sister or friend. They will enjoy it! 
PS2: Eighty percent of success is showing up. (Woody Allen)

When: 4th Tuesday of every month. 7-10pm

Where: Fitzpatrick Hotel Bar (687 Lexington Avenue btwn 56th/57th – Manhattan, NY)

Description

Come share a drink (pub-grub, too) with like-minded Libertarians . . . Monthly, the 4th Tuesday at 7pm, we gather at the Fitzpatrick Hotel bar, 687 Lexington Avenue between 56th and 57th Streets, to exchange ideas . . . sharpen our talking points . . . lament in unison over the wayward state of the world . . . and, finding it largely unimproved, we return for more the next month. Join us!
results.name: Liberty Happy Hour

results.description:
Topic 1 - Exploring (real) loT Attack Surface

Topic 2 - OWASP Website Project - Let's Fix This!


AGENDA 

7:00pm - Networking

Session 1 

Exploring (real) IoT Attack Surface, Michael Zusman 

Carve has been demonstrating meaningful attacks against IoT devices since... well, before they were called "IoT"! We're going to walk you through some of the coolest bugs we've responsibly disclosed to OEMs (that have now been fixed) and some of our testing methodology. Believe us: we're tired of raising the alarm about IoT insecurity, too. Who cares if I can get your wifi password from a doorbell? So instead, we're going to show you how to test your own IoT devices and some attack surface that you (maybe) didn't even know was there! We'll also talk about how to set up your networks to ...


Session 2 

OWASP Front-end back-end redesign project, Sooryen Technologies

This is a working session where Sooreyn will gather feedback from attendees and get feedback from them. 

Sooryen-OWASP Work Session Agenda:
1. Provide project overview, goals and current tasks/status
2. Provide a summary of collected survey data and audience feedback for further validation of data
3. Provide a summary of conducted interviews and pain-points identified
4. Peer Analysis Examination - a look at competing/partner/non-profit websites
5. Evaluation of some recommendations/mock-ups for new site and community feedback


Join this session to help shape the future design and site changes at OWASP Foundation from Projects, Chapters, Membership and more!  A project has been awarded and this is a working session for the benefit of all members

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxI4iTO_QojvY0ItSk56aWY3WXM/view?pref=2&pli=1

https://youtu.be/L_YzLLRyMVw

==================================

The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a 501(c)(3)worldwide not-for-profit charitable organization focused on improving the security of software. Our mission is to make software security visible, so that individuals and organizations worldwide can make informed decisions about true software security risks. OWASP does not endorse or recommend commercial products or services, allowing our community to remain vendor neutral with the collective wisdom of the best minds in software security worldwide. 

====================================

To access thousands of hours of video content, hundreds of projects visit www.owasp.org today.

• Special thanks to our all of our local chapter supporters.  

• Please help us to continued to raise visibility by supporting our Chapter by becoming an OWASP Member.  Join or renew your membership, click here.

• Help raise visibility for your company.  Discuss the opportunities with them of becoming a Local Chapter Supporter.  For more information, click here.

• If you have any questions or need any additional information, please contact Dawn Aitken, Program Manager at [masked] or[masked]-6186.
results.name: Bergen County, NJ Cyber Security Meetup

results.description:
[Note from David: 230 Fifth is acknowledged as NYC's best rooftop bar, as well as its biggest. There is something magical about it -- the outstanding views, the large and beautiful rooftop space, and the luxurious downstairs penthouse. This place gets packed during the summer. Fortunately we have our own large seating area. Read the reviews below from New York Magazine and Zagat. They'll give you a sense of why everyone loves this place.]

"230 Fifth" is a plush lounge located on the 20th floor of the building formerly known as the Victoria Hotel in the Flatiron District of Manhattan. It consists of two floors with 8,000 sq. ft of enclosed space and a magnificently landscaped 14,000 sq. ft rooftop garden. It is the largest rooftop garden in Manhattan. You’ll be in love with the great views of the city this venue has to offer of the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Statue of Liberty, and Hudson River.

What better way to celebrate the arrival of spring -- finally! -- and our little (alright, big) vegetarian/vegan family reaching 10,000 members than taking in the spectacular views from the rooftop at 230 Fifth. We are gathering for a well-deserved drinks night to mix and mingle with new and old friends.

Our event officially runs from 7pm to 9pm, but many of us will be staying past 10pm.  Having said that, we suggest you get there as close to 7pm as possible.

230 Fifth Ave., 20th fl., New York, NY 10001
at 27th St.

http://www.230-fifth.com/

It's a New York Magazine's Critics' Pick.  Here's what New York Magazine says about this lovely venue:

"The staid marble lobby of the office building that was formerly the Victoria Hotel does little to prepare one for the scene on the 20th floor: If the 8,000-square foot room pimped out in walls of partitioned glass, dark op-art pile carpet, and purple fluorescent lights recalls Studio 54, it's because the owner, art collector Steven Greenberg, has spared no expense in making it as lavish as his previous projects, the Roxy and the Palladium. The Sue et Mare couch came from Karl Lagerfeld's collection, and a maze of other low-to-the-ground loungers such as a kiss-shaped velour loveseat are similarly flamboyant. The skyline twinkles beyond floor-to-ceiling windows framed by white curtains, but the scene is even more impressive on the massive roof deck where an endless array of wood benches and sturdy garden chairs invite no less than 500 quitting-timers and night owls to take in unobstructed views of the Empire State Building to the north, the Met Life building to the east, and Jersey to the west. As the palm trees rustle and the old-fashioned cocktails kick in, you can easily imagine Don Johnson landing his helicopter near the stuffed zebra and cruising for foxy investment bankers."

From the Zagat Nightlife guide:

"There's lots of scene and scenery to be had at this commanding duplex near Madison Square, voted Most Popular nightspot in NYC; its giant greenery-lined roof deck with killer views of the Empire State Building draws throngs of flirty corporate who ignore the sky-high tabs and penthouse level that looks like something out of Scarface; even though some of the crowd seems to be auditioning for the Jersey Shore, this one's magical on a summer night."

Here's a great reference site for vegan beer, wine, and other liquor: http://www.barnivore.com

With all the wonderful vegetarians and vegans who attend each of our events, every event we do is liked by our members, but our "Veg Night Out!" events are the most popular of all. People enjoy the fact they can mingle (speak with lots of different people), and they love the beautiful venues that we go to. Join us for a stellar evening of lively conversation and lovely surroundings with fellow vegetarians and vegans.

There is no cover and no minimum. But please do buy a drink or two, or as many as you like. (Note: there is a large selection of non-alcoholic drinks available, if you prefer to avoid alcohol.)

For our new members: this is an incredibly friendly and welcoming group. We'll have our own section in the club, and you can get to know all our wonderful members.

Our event officially runs from 7:00pm to 9:00pm. I am sure a good number of us will be staying past 10:00pm. But we do encourage you to arrive as close to 7:00pm as possible.


How To Find Our Group at 230 Fifth:

After entering the front door to 230 Fifth Avenue, you will be directed to an elevator to the 20th Floor (Penthouse level). In the Penthouse you'll see a staircase to the roof.  On the roof, look for the sign: "NYC Vegetarian and Vegan Meetup".  That is our section.

I hope you can join us on this special evening.

David

results.description:
LIVE STREAM FROM SILICON VALLEY.  

PLEASE RSVP ON THIS MEETUP SITE AND YOU WILL BE SENT INSTRUCTIONS TO GET THE LINK.

----------------------------------------------------

Access Silicon Valley and Women's Startup Lab invite you to join us on May 24, 2016, for an INCREDIBLY special evening with STEVE GOLDBERG, an operating partner at Venrock, one of the Valley’s most sought after, early stage firms! Some of Venrock's early stage investments include: Apple, Intel, Illumina, AppNexus, Dollar Shave Club, AthenaHealth, Klout, Gilead, Acceleron, Cloudflare.

In this Fireside Chat--Unleashed event (we call it "unleashed" because it is interactive, audience driven), Steve will discuss topics of burning interest to startup entrepreneurs and investors. Join us for this one-night only event of uniquely combined insights from both the VC and entrepreneur perspectives!

Don't miss STEVE GOLDBERG unleashed!!  


AGENDA

 7:00pm - 8:30pm PST: Discussion with Steve

ABOUT STEVE


Steve is a prominent VC in Iot, robotics, wireless and signal processing companies and has significant experience as VC, founder and entrepreneur, with profound insights to share.

Prior to Venrock, Steve co-founded DataRunway, Inc., a broadband wireless communications company and was CEO of several early stage companies including Vidient, Arcwave and CoWave Networks. During his tenure at Arcwave the company raised over $28M from a number of first tier venture capital firms including Mayfield, Venrock, SBV, Lucent, Comcast Interactive Capital and Vulcan Capital.

He currently serves in the Board of Directors of several companies: Red Seal, SV Forum, Future Dial and Quantenna Communications.


 ABOUT VENROCK


Originally established as the venture capital arm of the Rockefeller family in 1969, Venrock partners with entrepreneurs to build some of the world’s most disruptive, successful companies. 

Venrock led Apple's first venture round and held a board seat for nearly 20 years. Also, in its first year Venrock invested in Intel, one of the most successful chip companies in the world.

SELECT INVESTMENTS:


LOOKING FOR A SPONSOR: We are looking for a sponsor for the live stream, and if anyone is interested, please shoot me a message. The stream is broadcast to startup entrepreneurs (Access Silicon Valley members) in San Diego, Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York, Boston, Chicago, Seattle, Austin, Houston, Dallas, Miami, Gainesville, Boulder/Denver, Tel Aviv, Toronto and Mexico City, and the sponsor will have their logo prominently displayed on the video during the entire event (and on the video wherever it may be posted) and a shout out at the event before it starts.

EVENT ORGANIZERS:



PREMIER SPONSORS:

Procopio- Ranked among the 2014 Best Law Firms by U.S. News & World Report

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds/credit: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund, please provide the Paypal Transaction ID: 18D76937M[masked]R No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W 77th street): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors, check for pictures. the door is closed but unlocked, report to our security and go to the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Help us to post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Thanks to all who could make Tuesday's talk and reading - I Rule my Mind (video below). We had a lively discussion with some new members and we're happy to welcome all who would like to attend. Please RSVP before Tuesday, 5/24 to attend our next meeting.

https://youtu.be/lX5DPw9Huik

This week we'll read and discuss the idea "To Have, Give All to All". Jeff sent a beautiful email out regarding this idea -

Try as you may, you cannot 'get'! You can never 'get enough' of what you don't Really Want... you only 'think' you can... The concept of 'getting' implies lack and loss which is why You Always lose or experience loss whenever you attempt to 'get or gain'... Conversely, You Can Always Have because You Do Always Have... but in order To Retain awareness of What You Have, You Must Share Having... And this idea of Having goes completely against the entire framework and logic of your separate self thought system... which is why Jesus says, 'To Have All, Give All in order To Know You Have All'...

We hope you'll join us this Tuesday to read and discuss this powerful and expansive idea. We are happy and honored by your participation.
results.name: ACIM - To Have, Give All To All

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

We'll be following up with our Concepts in Bitcoin Series - discussing concepts in Bitcoin and the blockchain - from how a public address is created from a private address, down to how Mining works, and up to what bitcoin is in general.

Our topics and questions for this session:

What is the work that miners are doing? What number are they searching for? In this session we will cover everything from what  a nonce is, to how difficulty adjusts, to how mining pools work. Prerequisites: We will give a 5 min review of what a cryptographic hash function is, but if you missed the last lesson we recommend you read up on the topic before class.


Meet people in the cryptocurrency space and get involved in the Coinspace movement!

Note: due to building security policies, attendees must RSVP 24 hours in advance (by Monday at 7:00PM), and must arrive at the event before 8:00PM on Tuesday.


Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Moat

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

Our Tiffany works for a charity hosting a fundraiser on Menstrual Hygiene Day, May 24 in Brooklyn. It's a screening of short films that benefits Water Aid US ( www.wateraid.org/us). It is right up our alley and I hope a lot of you join us. It's for a great cause and ticket price includes popcorn and 2 premium (i.e. alcohol). 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/period-power-screening-event-tickets-24635102254?aff=eac2 

Tiffany also made a special discount code for the Smutty Book Club - 10% off when using the code SBC at checkout! Actually you enter the code where you are selecting number of tickets. And order by May 10th to save and extra $10!

Some of the statistics are staggering (23% of girls in India drop out of school when they get their periods because the schools don't have toilets where they can change and dispose of their products). 


In honor of Menstrual Hygiene Day, WaterAid will activate dialogue around the taboo subject of menstruation through our award-winning documentary, Across the Tracks and WaterAid’s comedic video shorts, If Men Had Periods, as well as other short videos. Film screening will be followed by Q&A and panel discussion with leaders who are doing great things for women and girls everywhere. Panelists include: 


Cecile Shrestha (Moderator) - Associate Director, Philanthropy, WaterAidAmerica
David Linton - Professor Emeritus, Marymount Manhattan College and Board Member, Society for Menstrual Cycle Research
Priya Patel - Improv, sketch and standup comedienne

Ticket prices include popcorn and two premium beverages.

results.description:
Next episode of Eco-Logic, 2 hrs. Tuesday, May 24, 7 PM

Lest we forget that the Trans-Pacific Partnership is not a done deal and the world still needs us to oppose it. All the presidential candidates have come out against it (Hillary Clinton had advocated for it until recently). The Republican Tea Party and the "Elizabeth Warren wing" of the Democratic Party are against it. The president is for it. The Republican leadership is for it.

This episode of Eco-Logic is from a panel that's never before been aired on radio. It contains basic AND detailed information about the Trans-Pacific Partnership. What is TPP? It's explained. What's the difference between NAFTA and TPP? It's explained. How is TPP pro-fracking? Why did it take some Organized Labor so long to oppose TPP? Why would any local congressman support it? It's all explained.

Some time ago, the Joseph S. Murphy Institute for Worker Education and Labor Studies presented a forum entitled “A Back-Room Deal For The 1%; The Trans-Pacific Partnership.” The speakers were: Arthur Stamoulis, Executive Director of Citizens Trade Campaign; Celeste Drake, Trade and Globalization Policy Specialist with the AFL-CIO; and Kian Frederick, New York State Director of Citizens Trade Campaign.

Tune in this Tuesday to hear what they have to say.

Joining me live will be Donna Stein of Trade Justice Metro and the New York City Friends of Clearwater.

results.description:
Come join us for Figure Drawing night at The Artist Den in Bayonne, with a live nude model!! 

It's only $10 per person!

Feel free to BYOB , and BYOS (snacks)This is non-instructional meetup, however, all levels, from total beginners to seasoned pros are welcome (must be 18 and up! 

Please bring your own materials: charcoal, pens, watercolors, gouache, acrylic, pencils, sketch pads, canvas's, its your choice!!! (However, no oil paint and no sprays please.)

We will start with short 1 minute poses and work up to a 30 minute pose by the end of the session and we will take breaks periodically throughout the evening. Please note we will probably start around 7:15pm to allow everyone time to arrive.


There are seats and tables as well as several table easels and light weight easels. 

If you have any questions please feel free to email me ([masked]). 


Come collaborate, communicate and hang out with other creatives! Let's inspire one another!


See you soon and happy drawing!


Tiffany

***Parking is sometimes tight, there is more street parking 1& 2 short blocks down on 8th & 9th street on Avenue A - (we are on 10th & A.)
results.how_to_find_us: www.theartistdennj.com

results.description:
******PLEASE NOTE: TGI FRIDAYS CLOSES AT MIDNIGHT, SO LET'S ALL MAKE SURE TO BE OUT BEFORE THEN & NOT OVERSTAY OUR WELCOME.******

Come join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup.

We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Carcassonne & Ticket to Ride to Zombicide & heavier Eurogames! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our gracious hosts, you MUST purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play, feel free to ask. I am sure between us all, we should have it.

-------------------------------------

We always welcome new people & we're all here to have fun, but we do have a few ground rules that we ask everyone to be aware of:

- Treat everyone in the group with respect & do not discriminate. Some of us "trash talk" when we play, but it's all in good fun & in the spirit of gaming.

- This is a restaurant/bar so accidents are bound to happen. However, if you're responsible for ruining someone else's game by spilling a beverage or food on it, the right thing to do is to offer to purchase a new copy for them. Some of the games we bring are out of print so please treat every board game with respect.

- If a game is accidentally ruined by a staff member, everyone at the table should pitch in to buy a new one for the owner. More often than not, this comes to about $10/person or less, so in our opinion it isn't too much to ask for.

Thanks everyone & see you on Tuesday night!

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/431969846974239/"></a>
results.name: Tuesday Night Weekly Game Night at TGIF

Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

Interested in improving your public speaking skills?  

Want to meet new people and engage in interesting discussions? 


Hoping to make new business and life connections?  


If so we welcome you to attend the next Greenspeakers meeting.  Greenspeakers is a Toastmasters club that was founded by Green Party members years ago to provide a forum for engaged and intelligent citizens to improve their public speaking skills.  The club isn't as focused on politics as it once was but many members do love to debate.  

Every person who attends Greenspeakers will have a chance to speak and all will learn helpful tricks to become a more confident public speaker and communicator.  

Hope to see you there!

(We do not discriminate based on political beliefs.)

results.name: Come practice and improve your public speaking skills!

results.description:
Relationships are central to living “the good life.” Most of us want to find ways to improve our relationships – including with partners, children, parents, other family, friends, people at work or in our communities. We can connect more empathically and authentically with the people in our lives through learning new skills and approaches in communication. 


The old joke about how to get to Carnegie Hall – “practice, practice, practice” – is also true of improving our ability to connect with other people in our lives. Most of us don’t unlearn old habits and learn new ones by going to a short class or reading a book! A communications practice group combines learning new skills with – yes – practicing them. 


We’ll learn more about how to both express our own needs in ways we’re more likely to be heard, and listen for the needs others are expressing — even when they’re speaking in ways we find it difficult to hear them. We’ll practice how to handle conflicts in our lives with comfort, courage and confidence, instead of avoiding conflicts or approaching them with force. Taking in feedback on our own attempts and giving feedback to others is part of the practice process.

 
Using ideas and methods based on the Nonviolent Communication™ (NVC) process developed by Marshall Rosenberg, we will learn to connect more authentically with those in our lives. Our group will be facilitated by Marty Epstein, facilitator of workshops and small groups with Nonviolent Communication™. 


All levels of learning and experience welcome. Books on Nonviolent Communication™ (NVC) will be available for purchase at the sessions for those who find that kind of study helpful. 


Suggested donation: $10-$25 per session. (If that’s a stretch for your budget, come anyway, and pay what you would enjoy contributing to help make these sessions possible.) 


When, where and how often: We’ll meet twice a month on Thursday evenings from 7 to 9 pm. We’ll meet at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture, which is sponsoring this program as part of our mission to inspire people to live more humanely, respecting the worth of every person. 


More information: email [masked] if you have questions or concerns you’d like answered. 


“All that has been integrated into NVC has been known for centuries about consciousness, language, communication skills, and use of power that enable us to maintain a perspective of empathy for ourselves and others, even under trying conditions.” — Marshall B. Rosenberg, Ph.D.
results.how_to_find_us: www.rysec.org/directions
results.name: Practice Group: Communication for Connection

results.description:
Click here to buy tickets

Does "Early Music" refer only to Europe?

Our New York season comes to a close with music from the beginning. Don't miss this very special evening, co-presented by our friends at Goddard Riverside, the Bernie Wohl Center and Afro Roots Tuesdays.

The chants and dances of Western Africa pre-date by centuries any music that we currently refer to as "early.” Come hear some of the oldest music known to us today – music that survived a harrowing ocean journey, centuries in the shadows of the Land of the Free, and which continues to pulse with enduring power through the amplified soundscape of modern popular song.

Acclaimed Liberian soprano Dawn Padmore, scholar & drummer Anicet Mundundu, and kora master Yacouba Sissoko are joined by Afro Roots Artistic Director, percussion virtuoso and multi-instrumentalist Kevin Nathaniel in a thrilling performance of traditional Western African music from the areas that we now know of as Ghana, Liberia, Ivory Coast, Nigeria, Senegal and Sierra Leone.
results.name: In the Beginning: Early Music of Western Africa

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]

results.description:
http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/6/b/b/event_7042203.jpegCome join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) in a lively, friendly, facilitated discussion group for men, women, genderqueer, transgender, and not-quite-sure people, as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension, as long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual, bi-curious, questioning, queer, “I don’t label myself,” bi-friendly or some other non-monosexual identity).

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave.

The group meets at The LOFT, the LGBTQ safe space in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month.

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.
results.name: 4th Tuesday Westchester Bisexual Discussion & Support Group

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.


Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.name: Great tea, coffee, games, unplugged performances, writers, and artists!

Come experience the amazing healing power of Pranic Energy!

All you need to do it relax and receive. You will be guided into a deep meditative state where you will experience the power of meditation and your own mind! Here you will receive the deep, intelligent, healing & nourishing Energy Of Prana.

Prana is the intelligent life force energy in and around everything. It is the energy that creates galaxies and keeps them spinning. The energy which directs the growth of an embryo and the flourishing of a Forrest. It is the energy that keeps us alive, healthy & vital. When mastered through practices like Tai Chi, Qi Gong, Yoga, and Pranic Breathing, Prana can be cultivated, stored, directed and utilized in daily life. When received through another Pranic Being during deep relaxation it can wash over your entire being like a cleansing rainstorm washing away toxins, accumulations, pains, tensions and limiting patterns creating space for deep healing, nourishing and transformation. Even if it sounds mystical to you, I assure you it is simply the most natural and intelligent process in the world! Come discovery the ease with which you can heal and transform if you only show up and allow it!

Let love in

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals. Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Business Developers provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

results.description:
A fresh paint job has the power to totally transform the look of your home in less time and for less cash than any other remodeling project.  That thin skin of paint also protects your investment, shielding it from the sun, wind, and rain.  Hiring a processional painter to paint your home is not a decision to take lightly.  While anybody can slap paint onto your walls, it takes considerable expertise and experience to get a truly high quality finish.  Join us as Justin Griffing, Owner of WOW 1 Day Painting of Bergen County explains the services they offer.  WOW 1 Day Painting are experienced painting professionals in residential and commercial painting, providing both interior and exterior painting services at reasonable prices.  Other painters may take days or weeks to complete your painting job, but they will do it in just 1 Day without charging a premium to do it.   The eco-friendly painting service uses zero VOC and low VOC paint to minimize the impact on the environment and your family, pets and staff.

Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on May 25th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
Professionals Exchanging Ideas and Referrals (PEIR), is an independent networking group of business professionals dedicated to the business growth and success of each of our members.  We meet in Berkeley Heights, NJ; our members represent businesses from the surrounding 15 mile radius. 

We are currently seeking new affiliates in business categories not represented by our present membership.  Note - we are not about handing out business cards, but rather we are about building trusted business relationships and sharing business acumen.  Think networking PLUS a mastermind  group.  Please "opt-out" if not serious about a long-term professional relationship.

• We generally meet on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday mornings of the month (8:30am to 10:00am) with periodic evening networking and social events.

• We expect regular attendance at meetings, but understand that business (and life) will occasionally “trump” your attendance. 

• We seek legitimate business referrals and opportunities, and recognize these do not arise weekly.  Members should be “givers” as well as “takers”. 

• Our semi-annual dues are utilized for networking and member-only presentations and development. 

The following business areas are currently represented:

• Insurance – Property, Casualty & Life

• Mortgage Broker - Residential & Commercial

• Financial Advisor – Planning, Investments, Life, LTD, & LTC, Employee Benefits

• Residential Realtor

• Attorney – Business /  Real Estate / Estate Planning

• Web Design / e-Marketing / Graphic Design

• Title Insurance – Residential/Commercial

• Property Restoration -  Fire, Water, Smoke

• Interior Design -  residential & commercial

Examples of businesses we are seeking to join us (not all-inclusive):

Architect - Banking -  Business Consultant – Commercial Lender - Commercial Realtor - Contractor - CPA/Tax Practitioner - Florist – Handyman – Health & Fitness Professionals - Photographer – Printer - Recruiter

Come and learn about the Chamber's mission, our agenda for connecting LGBT businesses and business people together, the process and advantages of becoming a certified LGBT owned business and enjoy a continental breakfast provided by PSE&G's Gay and Lesbian Alliance (GaLa), while you meet and mingle with other LGBT business owners and business people.

LGBT Enterprise certification provides a host of opportunities to enhance your business visibility to do business with LGBT suppliers and Diversity Directors across the country. Your certification can lead to face-to-face meetings with suppliers at NGLCC matchmaking events, which are held throughout the year.  This certification also opens the doors for scholarship programs, mentorship and leadership training. 

The NJ LGBT Chamber can connect you to many organizations and people, to leverage opportunities for new business and business connections.

For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.

results.description:
***********************

To join the May Tourney please just go through our Join Page:  https://TennisNewYork.com/join
***********************


How does the TennisNewYork Tournament Work?

Every Match Counts *NEW* for 2015

Tennis Tournament Basic Concept

 Our tournaments are a single elimination format with a consolation bracket. Meaning you are guaranteed at least 2 matches. This tournament format will not be played at a single location over a weekend instead players are given 7 to 10 days to play each round's match.

 Our tournaments will be mixed gender unless we have particularly strong female enrollment in a city. The tournaments will be singles based until we receive enough response to open it up for doubles. Players will be grouped in brackets with players no greater than .5 of their current TLN League Rating. Meaning Skilled - 3.0 players will be matched with other 3.0 players and at most with Competitive - 3.5 level players. Competitive - 3.5 level players could be grouped with Advanced - 4.0 players but will not have Elite 4.5 level players in their bracket.

Our Guarantee

 We need at least 6 players to make a tournament bracket. If we can NOT reach this criteria then we will refund your entry fee and give you the next tournament for no cost. Our hope is to run multiple skill level brackets for each tournament. We are NOT going to show early enrollment for the tournaments. Also the 7-day money back guarantee expires as soon as the tournament starts. Tournaments will not allow for late enrollment.

Leveling

 All tournament players will need to have played 4 league/season or tennis ladder legacy matches before they can enter into a tournament. Players will be entered into the tournament that associates with their TLN's Player Rating. If a player wants to participate in a second draw at a rating higher than their Player Rating they will be allowed too.

Your Schedule and Availability

 These tournaments will be kicked off on Thursday's giving the first round opponents two weekends to play the first match and then each following round will have a full week to play the match. Players need to be local for at least the first 3 weeks after kickoff. Players with 1-week work trips or week long vacations during the first 3 weeks shouldn't participate in the tournament.

Seedings

  The TennisNewYork staff will seed 25% of the participants based veteran status (Most number of matches played in their career) with the program. If we have 8 players enrolled we'll seed the top 2 players, 16 players the top 4 players. The rest of the players will be randomly entered into the draw.

Consolation Bracket

 We will run a consolation bracket for the players who lost their first match. Seedings for the consolation bracket will be randomly selected by the TennisNewYork staff. The winner of the consolation bracket will receive a $25 Tennis Warehouse Gift Card.

Where to Play?

  Because the seeding of the tournament is mainly randomize the higher seed will NOT have home court preference. The league strongly suggests you meet half-way to cut the commute in half for both players. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts that have user submitted ratings. If two players need guidance they can certainly email our staff for suggestions.


Special Note for NYC players: We don't have any special privileges to use the courts throughout New York City. You do need to follow by the rules provided by the Parks Department. How to reserve tennis courts in NYC: NYC Park & Rec.


Playing Format

  The preferred playing format for tournaments should be 2 sets with a 3rd set tie-breaker or 2 out of 3 sets. If the two players can't agree the default format will be the 2 sets with a 3rd set tie-breaker. In NYC we will accept 10 game pro set results mainly due to court availability.

Target Audience

  This will be our most competitive format. The target audience is for the player who are good sports and love to play competitive matches.

Prize Pool

 The prize pool will be based upon enrollment in each bracket. A tournament can have multiple brackets. The tournament prize structure is based around our partner Tennis Warehouse (TW).

6 to 10 players: $50 TW Gift Card for the winner*, $25 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for Consolation bracket winner
11 to 16: $100 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $50 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for Consolation winner
17 to 24: $150 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $50 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for 3rd & 4th place, $50 TW GC for Consolation winner
25+: $200 TW GC for the winner* + Trophy, $100 TW GC for Finalist, $25 TW GC for 3rd and 4th place, $50 TW GC for Consolation winner

 All tournament champions will be receive an entry into the End of the Year National Tourneys at the champions discounted rate.

Cost to Participate

Tourney's have a new cost structure for 2016. First ten players will pay only $19.95. Next ten players will pay $22.95 and any following players will pay $24.95.

Join Today!!

  So Join Today and we'd be happy to get you enrolled into the next tournament.
