results.description:
Update: here is the link to the brief for tomorrow's Mini UX Hackathon.

**************

Hi Everyone,


In collaboration with Product & UX Hackathons and Hackers 4 Good, we are putting together a UX Prototyping Mini Hackathon at Microsoft to help WeShelter.org end homelessness. This event is for anyone interested in UX/UI/Product Design, Web and Mobile Development and doing the community some good by using their design skills.  

The event format will be approximately as follows:

* A chosen non-profit organization, in this case WeShelter.org, has been invited to provide a problem that they'd like help with – where they think that design and technology can help.

* During the 3 hour hackathon, teams will be able to put together a basic idea and prototype of their solution (we will provide exact schedule later on to ensure everyone is on track).

* Teams will have the opportunity to present their solution to the WeShelter.org team and UX mentors and get feedback. 

* The winning team, and others interested might continue working on the project, if they'd like to.

We have invited experienced mentors including Danny Setiawan, UX Lead from The Economist (more below) and Tremis Skeete, Product Designer from NexTier Innovations who agreed to help out and provide feedback on your prototypes. 

PLEASE NOTE:

* Computers and/or laptops will NOT be provided. You will need to bring your own.

* You are welcome to use any prototyping tool (e.g. InVision, Principle, Marvel, Pixate, Axure, etc).

All skill levels are welcome. Bring your favorite tools to sketch/prototype ideas and your laptop. Looking forward to meeting everyone!

More about our UX/Product mentors:


Danny Setiawan, UX Lead at The Economist

Danny has 15+ years of experience in the product design field that ranges from hands-on role to putting in place and optimizing a UX practice (hiring, coaching and establishing processes). Danny has managed various sizes of teams (up to 17 people) and worked with established brands such as The Economist, Yahoo! and Microsoft as well as startups like GeoCV, Navigine and Contently. Currently Danny is the UX Lead at The Economist , UXD Instructor  and Product & UX coach.


Tremis Skeete, Product Designer at NexTier Innovations

Tremis has 15+ years of experience working with teams that have helped clients such as Zel Technologies, The Altria Group, Barclays Bank, US Department of Defense, and L’oreal, building web sites, applications, intranets, and graphic communications across multiple media. When he is not working on teams for nexTier, he does freelance logo design work every chance he gets. He is an active member of the New York City UX Professionals Association (NYC UXPA), serves as a co-organizer for product design meetups and he is currently a graphic design mentor for middle and high school students.
results.name: UX Prototyping Mini Hackathon Series: Help End Homelessness

With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. 


Being a Solutions Engineer at Facebook means working in small teams and focusing on growing value for the world's largest and fastest growing businesses. We work quickly and collaboratively to build smarter, more meaningful solutions on a global scale.

Excerpt taken from the "The Single One In The Group Blog" here.


Honestly, it’s about time that we’ve done a “book club”  type of set up here at The Single One In The Group. And it makes perfect sense that I would choose such a striking title for our first book to discuss.

Of course this is mostly for the ladies out there, but as an equal opportunity “hash it out-er” I’d still love for a few fellas to come out and join us.

The book that we will be reading is by G. L. Lambert and is titled Men Don’t Love Women Like You:  The Brutal Truth About Dating, Relationships, and How To Go From Placeholder to Gamechanger.

Bold right?

Soooooo, it was perfectly fitting for me to encourage ya’ll to get this book so that we could all read it and then sit down together and try to figure this sh*t out collectively.

Cuz honestly, the “tolerating f*ckboy sh*t” is played out like a d*mn 8 track and if ya’ll are anything on my mental wavelength right now you’re just not here for it anymore.

So go and buy the book and let’s meet up and break it down. (Buy it here). I am scheduling the 1st meeting a little over 2 weeks away to give you time to order it and read the 1st 7 chapters.

The book is broken into 3 main subcategories: Awaken the Spartan Within, Date Like a Spartan, and Risk the D*ck. So if you’re in NYC here is the scheduling for the 3 Book Club Meetups related to this book.

Meeting 1:

Wednesday May 11, 2016 at 6:30 pm

Tentative Location – Epistrophy 200 Mott St.

Discussing Chapters 1 – 7:

Ch. 1 – Typical B*tch, Typical Results

Ch. 2 – He Loves You But He’s Not In Love With You

Ch. 3 – D*ck Lies: Using A Man’s Mind Against Him

Ch. 4 – Awaken The Spartan Within

Ch. 5 – The Spartan Secret

Ch. 6 – How To Become A Game Changer

Ch. 7 – How To Attract Men Without Even Trying

Meeting 2:

Wednesday May 18, 2016 at 6:30 pm

Tentative Location: Bread and Butter - 419 Park Avenue South 

Discussing Chapters  8 – 21:

Ch. 8 – The 5 Reasons You Failed At Dating

Ch. 9 – Pre-Date Battle Plan

Ch. 10 – Date Night Domination

Ch. 11 – Mastering the First Date

Ch. 12 – How To Ask The Right Questions

Ch. 13 – Post Date Do’s

Ch. 14 – Post Date Don’ts

Ch. 15 – Is His D*ck Spartan Proof?

Ch. 16 – Slaying the Second Date

Ch. 17 – Second Date Checklist

Ch. 18 – Add Him To The Roster or Release Him

Ch. 19 – When To Have Sex

Ch. 20 – How To Transition From Dating To A Relationship

Ch. 21 – The Thing Every Woman Must Do Before Agreeing To A Relationship

Meeting 3:

Wednesday May 25, 2016 at 6:30 pm

Tentative Location: 419 Park Avenue South 

Discussing Chapters – 22 – 27:

Ch. 22 – Do You Know How To Be A Girlfriend?

Ch. 23 – First Cracks: Conquering Early Relationship Problems

Ch. 24 – Emotional Support: Helping A Man Without Emasculating Him

Ch. 25 – He’s Not A Victim: How To Stop Boyfriend Manipulation

Ch. 26 – Growing Apart: Threesomes, Breaks, & Other Mistakes

Ch. 27 – How To Stop A Breakup

For those of you who are not in NYC you can still join us in dissecting this book, as I will be creating a place for us to discuss it on our Facebook page. So head on over to Amazon and buy it as soon as possible… I have a feeling that it’s going to be a good read. Especially for those of us who have graduated from dating like weak women and want to date like what the author calls “A Spartan!”.

See you on May 11, 18, and 25th!

results.description:
Join us in NYC May 25th to hear from Matt Daniels, founder of the data-driven storytelling site Polygraph. One of his latest projects examines film dialogue from 2,000 screenplays, broken down by gender and age. See the full project here. 

In this talk, Matt will, step-by-step, discuss the data scraping and cleaning process for computing dialogue by gender for 2,000 screenplays. He'll review the Python scripts and databases used to house nearly 4 million lines of dialogue, he'll discuss how he mapped the data to IMDB, and will also go over his approach to visualizing the data in D3. The focus for this talk is practical: pro-tips and best practices for how he managed his most messy, complex project to date.

Food and drinks will be provided. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING 

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
Suggested donation: $10(optional)


O Pagador de Promessas was the only Brazilian movie to ever win a Golden Palm in Cannes (1962), and the first South American film to be nominated for an Oscar. The movie was also nominated for an Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film.

Zé do Burro (Leonardo Villar) is a landowner from Nordeste. His best friend is a donkey. When his donkey falls terminally ill, Zé promises to a Candomblé orisha, Iansan, that if his donkey recovers, he will give away his land to the poor and carry a cross all the way from his farm to the Saint Bárbara Church in Salvador, Bahia. The film captured the world audiences with poetic tragical story set against the backround of Bahian folklore, capoeirists and dancers.

Directed by Anselmo Duarte, 1 hr. 38 min., Portuguese with English subtitles.

PRESENTED BY: 
- Ticún Brasil, Jewish art and volunteering in Brazil. Since 2008 Ticún creates mutual inspirations for Brazilian and international art communities via innovative cultural exchange programs. Our projects promote lesser known sides of Brazilian art, provide volunteering opportunities for travelers to Brazil and connect artists worldwide. Ticún Brasil activities range from teaching photography in favelas to art residencies, improvisational music cinematic concerts, Jewish and Afro-Brazilian studies and poetry presentations in Rio de Janeiro and New York. <a>http://ticunbrasil.com/</a>;

- The Brazilian Endowment for the Arts mission is to promote, cultivate the Portuguese language and Brazilian literature, Art, Music and Film. http://brazilianendowmentforthearts.org/ 

- Produced in Brazil, Yaguara Cachaça is the first blended white organic cachaça in the world. Having established itself in the Brazilian market, Yaguara makes its U.S. debut in select restaurants, bars, and off-premise locations in New York. A combination of the latest in distilling technology and centuries of high quality craftsmanship, this is a spirit that surprises. 
http://cachacayaguara.com/EN/
results.name: Brazilian movie and cachaça tasting - "O Pagador de Promessas"

results.description:
Update: here is the hackathon brief.

*************

Important: 

- You will need to bring your laptop for this! ;)

- You need to know how to use a prototyping tool (any tools of your choice like InVision or Principle for Mac, Pixate, Axure, etc., etc.)

*************

Hey Everyone,

Welcome to our next event in the Mini UX Hackathon Series, which will be hosted by Microsoft (we are collaborating with a couple of other meetups on the event, especially with Hackers 4 Good, so the attendance count will be much higher than you see here). 

This meetup is for anyone interested in UX/UI Design, Product Design, Web and Mobile Development and doing good using their skills.  

The hackathon format will be approximately as following:

• A chosen non-profit organization, in this case WeShelter.org, has been invited to provide a problem that they'd like help with – where they think that design and technology can help.

• During the 3 hour hackathon the teams will be able to put together a basic idea and prototype of their solution (we will provide exact schedule later on to ensure everyone is on track).

• Teams will have the opportunity to present their solution to the WeShelter.org team and UX mentors and get feedback.


• The winning team, and others interested might continue working on the project, if they'd like to.

We have invited experienced mentors including Danny Setiawan, UX Lead  from The Economist (more below), who agreed to help out and provide feedback on your prototypes. 

All skill levels are welcome. Bring your favorite tools to sketch/prototype ideas and your laptop. Looking forward to meeting everyone! :)

Thank you, 
Michael and Francesco


More about our UX mentors:

Danny Setiawan, UX Lead at The Economist

15+ years of experience in product design field that ranges from hands-on role to putting in place and optimizing a UX practice (hiring, coaching and establishing processes). Danny has managed various sizes of teams (up to 17 people) and worked with established brands such as The Economist, Yahoo! and Microsoft as well as startups like GeoCV, Navigine and Contently. Currently Danny is the UX Lead at The Economist , UXD Instructor  and Product & UX coach.

Tremis Skeete, Product Designer at NexTier Innovations


Tremis has 15+ years of experience working with teams that have helped clients such as Zel Technologies, The Altria Group, Barclays Bank, US Department of Defense, and L’oreal, building web sites, applications, intranets, and graphic communications across multiple media. When he is not working on teams for nexTier, he does freelance logo design work every chance he gets. He is an active member of the New York City UX Professionals Association (NYC UXPA), serves as a co-organizer for product design meetups and he is currently a graphic design mentor for middle and high school students.
results.name: UX Prototyping Mini Hackathon Series: Help End Homelessness

Grace Hopper Academy will use a deferred tuition model, where students pay for their education only after after starting a rewarding career as a software developer. We succeed when you do!

results.description:
Let's get together, drink, and talk about a new book.  We will meet at Buddha Beer Bar per several recommendations (and it is dumpling night!).

This month we will read The Girl on the Train by Paula Hawkins.  It will become a movie soon (preview to the movie - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KkoEE1i0CX8) so reading it now will be on point!  See you all soon!

More about The Girl on the Train:


A debut psychological thriller that will forever change the way you look at other people’s lives.

Rachel takes the same commuter train every morning. Every day she rattles down the track, flashes past a stretch of cozy suburban homes, and stops at the signal that allows her to daily watch the same couple breakfasting on their deck. She’s even started to feel like she knows them. “Jess and Jason,” she calls them. Their life—as she sees it—is perfect. Not unlike the life she recently lost.

And then she sees something shocking. It’s only a minute until the train moves on, but it’s enough. Now everything’s changed. Unable to keep it to herself, Rachel offers what she knows to the police, and becomes inextricably entwined in what happens next, as well as in the lives of everyone involved. Has she done more harm than good?

Compulsively readable, The Girl on the Train is an emotionally immersive, Hitchcockian thriller and an electrifying debut.
results.name: Let's drink and talk about The Girl on the Train

results.description:
Celebrate the Sun’s transit into Gemini with gentle harmonious movement. Some have called this movement art social yoga, social tai chi, sacred dance, esoteric dance, integrated movement. 

Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle, led by Soulful Wizardess Marta Stemberger. We’ll move gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry.


Register early at http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
Space allows only up to 12 people.
$18 paid in advance via PayPal with credit or debit card
$20 at the door (cash only) if there is room.


* * * * *


The Sun enters the constellation of Gemini on May 20. The yellow Twins offer humanity the gift of the consonant H as it sounds in “happy” and in “human”. Now is the time to let go, be free, and shine.

• Move some gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry 

• Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle 

• Learn to move the eurythmy gestures for the consonant H and its different sounds in “happy” and in “human”, the vowel I (pronounced “ee”), and the music interval of the 7th

* * * * * 

Open to all who can walk. No prior movement experience is needed. We’ll simply breathe and flow in harmony with the sound and each other.

Please wear loose fitting clothes with long-sleeved tops and long loose pants or skirts. The tops should allow you to freely move arms all the way up, and still cover your belly area. We’ll move barefoot. No slippery socks or footwear please.


* * * * *
For more info visit and to register visit http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
results.name: BE FREE AND SHINE: Eurythmy Circle of Social Yoga, Social Tai Chi, Sacred Dance

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin

Emily Herzlin is a writer and teacher with a particular love for memoir and poetry. She received her MFA in Nonfiction from Columbia in 2012. She began practicing meditation in 2003. In college she found her way to the Interdependence Project, where she now teaches meditation courses and retreats. Emily trained in MBSR (Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction) at the University of Massachusetts Medical School. She has been teaching meditation since 2011 to groups and individuals.

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

On Wednesday, May 25th, at 7pm, join New York City cigar and scotch enthusiasts for our first rooftop event of 2016 at The Hyatt Herald Square. Guests will enjoy La Pluma Cigars as well as two whiskies from Breuckelen Distillery and Amador Whiskey Co. 

Grab a friend and come enjoy cigars + whiskey and sweeping skyline views up Midtown and the FiDi!

Ticket includes:

One La Pluma CigarOne glass Breuckelen New York Wheat WhiskeyOne glass Amador Ten Barrel Whiskey

Dress code: classy casual

Breuckelen New York Wheat Whiskey

New York Wheat is distilled cleaner than more typical whiskeys. This method highlights the beauty of using wheat in a mash bill: a smoother, more gentle base lets the intense oak-contributed flavors be the focus. 1 to 2 years in our warehouse achieves the best balance. Distilled from 100% wheat, aged in new American oak.Amador Whiskey Co. Ten Barrels

Amador 10-Barrel 2nd release was crafted by the Charbay® Distillery Master Distillers Miles and Marko Karakasevic. A blend of 60% straight malt whiskey and 40% hop-flavored whiskey distilled from a craft IPA beer, the components were aged separately for over 2 years in French oak wine barrels and then “married” in our family Chardonnay barrels for another 2 years before being bottled.

The Fine Print / FAQ

You must be 21 or older to purchase tickets to this event. Those under 21 will not be allowed entrance into the club.

By signing up for this event, you give FineTobaccoNYC permission to send future cigar event invites via email.

What is your refund policy?

A full refund in the form of credit toward a future Fine Tobacco NYC event is available until 24 hours before an event.

Why do tickets cost a small amount more than advertised?

Eventbrite charges a small fee on each ticket sold which is added to the flat price of the ticket in return for use of the service. 

WHENWednesday, May 25, 2016 from 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM (EDT) - 

Add to Calendar

WHEREHyatt Herald Square - 30 W 31st St., New York, NY 10001 - 

View Map

venue.name: Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel

results.description:
Over the past few months we have had a huge influx of new members!  It is going to be a great summer and we are looking to kick things up with more great events and activities.  Please join us at The Lexington's Lounge at The Court Hotel for an informal welcome party and brief meeting to let you know how you can get involved more with our group.

Here is how it works:

-Please arrive by 7pm (we will be there beginning at 6pm)


-We will have a special section reserved for our group

-At 7pm we will have a brief presentation/meeting on what we are all about and how you can get involved.

-Following the meeting enjoy casual cocktails and conversations with others in the group.  Cash bar (food is available)

Can I come alone? Yes 95% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code: business casual

What is the age range?  The CRC has people in their 20's and people in their 40's.  The group is large enough that you will likely find many people in your demographic.
results.name: Get Involved New Members Welcome Meeting & Happy Hour

group.name: Holy Trinity Church - Contemporary Roman Catholics  NYC

results.description:
They say it takes 10 hours/week to succeed in the arts! Spend 2 with us and get your instrument sharp for auditions and roles!   

Of course if you just want to perform for fun it's A-OK too.  We have had a nice (and super entertaining) range of work and players and let's keep the good times rolling!

Join us for another session of The Actor's Gym this Tuesday! Bring in your audition material, a scene you would like to challenge yourself on, or just come willing to be cast on the spot in other member's scenes. The Actor's Gym has seen a lot of original scripts lately... its's amazing how creative and interesting these expressions have been. We are so excited to see them develop and possibly become treatments, shorts and full works! 

Keep it up guys and see you soon!
results.name: Get back to the gym for spring!

results.description:
This special event is a multi-meetup opportunity to gather to explore larger trends that are currently affecting all aspects of our lives. I would love to have you join us!

What's Next? An "All-in" Future

Would you like to be part of creating a world that…

…Is Deeply Connected
…Celebrates Uniqueness & Choice
…Cultivates Collaboration & The Greater Good
…Creates Conscious Innovation & Evolution

All at the same time?

Even with all the crazy in the world, we are waking up. Growing waves of us are realizing that so much more is possible. But it is just the beginning…

So, What's NEXT?

If you ask 100 people…”What does a better world look like?”…your going to get 100 different answers….

How can we create a vision of the future in which we can all agree and work towards together? How can  we come up with real world solutions that unify us?

In the seminar portion of the evening, you will learn:

• The four desires that motivate everything

• A powerful lens/framework that helps identify solutions to current challenges

• The shift that gives you exponential impact

• How to identify and work with different worldviews

• Ways to lead and encourage others that are “waking up”

• How to re-frame your version of “a perfect world” so that people want to be “all-in” with you

• Ways this shift in consciousness is different & what this next stage means

In the collaborative part of the evening, join other visionaries of all kinds to…

• Connect & Share Your Expertise and Deep Desires for the World

• Vision a World Where Everyone is “All-in”

• Collaborate to Solve Real World Issues

• Create Tangible Next Steps for Yourself & Our Emerging Community

This is the first in a three part series. You are welcome to come for one or any combination.

Cost: $20 per evening

General Schedule:
6:30pm – 7:00pm Connecting
7:00pm – 9:30pm Interactive Seminar & Small Groups
9:30pm – 10:00pm Socializing

You can pay at door or purchase a ticket online:
http://www.ollininstitute.com/whats-next-registration-nyc/

Each evening will also have a brief orientation to the Ollin Institute with information about how you can get involved in our evolutionary community, and use our network to promote your passion.

For more information:  http://www.ollininstitute.com/

A full list of the meetups invited is here.

New York Series Event Dates:

May 25th– An "All-in" Future
June 1st – "All-in" Collaboration
June 8th – An "All-in" Life

results.description:
ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!! Turf shoes and indoor shoes are ay-okay.

Permit Disclosure: We have a permit.

PLEASE BRING A WHITE SHIRT, A DARK SHIRT & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT

Game Host - JJ

Co-leader - JP Matiz

Location -We're playing outdoor at John Murray Playground in Long Island City.

PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 6:45pM!! Teams will be picked from this time.

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
Kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect PS2G plays clean soccer! This means no cursing, insulting, complaining, arguing or fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style or if you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

***BRING TURF SHOES OR SNEAKERS & A DARK, WHITE & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT***

AGAIN - NO CLEATS ALLOWED!

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free.

http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Wednesday 645PM CO-ED Soccer @ LIC (9v9) for PS2G

group.name: PS2G NYC-Coed Soccer Pickup for Charity -Play Soccer 2 Give

results.description:
Lightning Talks


by Everyone (including You?)

This month we are opening the floor again for a round of short 5-10 minute talks on whatever strikes your fancy -- projects you have been working on, obstacles you have encountered, neat tools you have discovered.

If you would like to present slides, please have them either online or in a standard format (pdf, html) on a usb. There will be a signup sheet onsite, but people are strongly encouraged to contact the event organizers via meetup to reserve a slot beforehand (click the "contact" link at http://www.meetup.com/NY-Haskell/).

All vaguely Haskell topics and all levels of expertise welcome. If you don't have much speaking experience, this is a great way to just dip your toe in the water.  It is your choice whether you want us to record and publish your talk or not.
results.name: Lightning Talks...tell us what interests you!

results.description:
In this workshop, we will create a simple app that queries the Foursquare API for a list of venues near a location specified by the user on a map.  The results will then be rendered as pins on the map view. This will be a good demonstration of basic tools and libraries such as Cocoa Pods and Alamofire. In addition, parsing the response from Foursquare is a good exercise for API integration in general.

This demo is a preview event for the Velocity 360 iOS Bootcamp as well as our part time course. For more information, please visit https://www.velocity360.io
results.name: MapKit with FourSquare API

results.description: Russ will be hosting a yoga class every Wednesday led by Leah and Meredith on alternating weeks.  The class is free and we have mats and other props to borrow. Please bring your own water. Suggested donation for Leah and Meredith of $2 would be great!  Space is limited to 16 people!
results.name: Wednesday Evening Yoga

results.description:
THE COSMIC COCKTAIL: Three Parts Dark Matter - Dr. Katherine Freese

The ordinary atoms that make up the known universe constitute only 5 percent of all matter and energy in the cosmos. The rest is known as dark matter and dark energy, because their precise identities are unknown. Theorists contend that dark matter consists of fundamental particles known as WIMPs , or weakly interacting massive particles. Billions of them pass through our bodies every second without us realizing it, yet their gravitational pull is capable of whirling stars and gas at breakneck speeds around the centers of galaxies, and bending light. 

The Cosmic Cocktail is the inside story of the epic quest to solve one of the most compelling enigmas of modern science—what is the universe made of?—told by one of today’s foremost pioneers in the study of dark matter, acclaimed University of Michigan theoretical physicist Katherine Freese. 

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: Great Lectures on DVD: The Cosmic Cocktail

results.description:
Celebrate the Sun’s transit into Gemini with gentle harmonious movement of eurythmy. Some have called this movement art social yoga, social tai chi, sacred dance, esoteric dance, integrated movement, movement meditation. 

Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle, led by Soulful Wizardess Marta Stemberger. We’ll move gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry. 

Register early at http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
Space allows only up to 12 people.
$18 paid in advance via PayPal with credit or debit card
$20 at the door (cash only) if there is room.

* * * * * 

The Sun enters the constellation of Gemini on May 20. The yellow Twins offer humanity the gift of the consonant H as it sounds in “happy” and in “human”. Now is the time to let go, be free, and shine.

• Move some gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry 

• Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle 

• Learn to move the eurythmy gestures for the consonant H and its different sounds in “happy” and in “human”, the vowel I (pronounced “ee”), and the music interval of the 7th

* * * * * 

Open to all who can walk. No prior movement experience is needed. We’ll simply breathe and flow in harmony with the sound and each other.

Please wear loose fitting clothes with long-sleeved tops and long loose pants or skirts. The tops should allow you to freely move arms all the way up, and still cover your belly area. We’ll move barefoot. No slippery socks or footwear please. 

* * * * *
For more info visit and to register visit http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
results.name: BE FREE AND SHINE: Eurythmy Circle of Social Yoga, Social Tai Chi, Sacred Dance

Exclusive Event

results.description:
Dear 350NYC Members and Friends,

2016 is already shaping up to be a big year for climate activists so let's keep the momentum going.  Join us and get involved!


Wednesday, May 25th @ 7-9pm

NEW MEMBERS:  If you're new to 350NYC please join us at  6:30pm  for a brief orientation to the group, learn about our working groups and some of the campaigns we are currently involved with.


AGENDA

1. For the first hour  --- AGENDA IN DEVELOPMENT

We may have a guest speaker - TBA.

- Feedback on BreakFree2016 in Albany and all the other actions we've been involved in this month

- Reports from working groups on our campaigns


2. For the second hour we'll be engaging everyone in preliminary planning for the upcoming summer activities in the run-up to the elections.  Some ideas on the table include:

- Vote Climate campaign

- Plan an educational forum in the fall on Carbon Tax & related issues

- Mobilizing for July 24th "March for a Clean Energy Revolution" in Philly

We have a lot of flexibility in what we do and much depends on your interests. Now is the time to bring your ideas and energy to this meeting and help shape the direction we take for the summer.

3.  Upcoming hearings and actions that you can support.

Looking forward to seeing you next week.

The 350NYC Team

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC
results.how_to_find_us: Go to front desk and ask where the downstairs stairwell is to the open mic.

results.description:
Celebrate the Sun’s transit into Gemini with gentle harmonious movement of eurythmy. Some have called this movement art social yoga, social tai chi, sacred dance, esoteric dance, integrated movement, movement meditation. 

Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle, led by Soulful Wizardess Marta Stemberger. We’ll move gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry. 

Register early at http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
Space allows only up to 12 people.
$18 paid in advance via PayPal with credit or debit card
$20 at the door (cash only) if there is room. 

* * * * *


The Sun enters the constellation of Gemini on May 20. The yellow Twins offer humanity the gift of the consonant H as it sounds in “happy” and in “human”. Now is the time to let go, be free, and shine.

• Move some gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry 

• Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle


• Learn to move the eurythmy gestures for the consonant H and its different sounds in “happy” and in “human”, the vowel I (pronounced “ee”), and the music interval of the 7th

* * * * *
Open to all who can walk. No prior movement experience is needed. We’ll simply breathe and flow in harmony with the sound and each other.

Please wear loose fitting clothes with long-sleeved tops and long loose pants or skirts. The tops should allow you to freely move arms all the way up, and still cover your belly area. We’ll move barefoot. No slippery socks or footwear please. 

* * * * *
For more info visit and to register visit http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
results.name: BE FREE AND SHINE: Eurythmy Circle of Social Yoga, Social Tai Chi, Sacred Dance

If you want to check out some tutorials ahead of Wednesday, check out the Missing Maps site.

Missing Maps is a collaboration between HOT, Doctors without Borders and global Red Cross organizations.

results.description:
Comic time! This week: The Crystal Empire So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friendship is Magic #36 &37 (descriptions and download links below) Welcome to our triumphant return to the main series. 


Friendship is Magic #36

With Celestia and Luna trapped in stone, Sombra prepares to do the same to Twilight, but he is too weakened to do so. After Radiant Hope convinces him to spare Twilight, Sombra makes plans to set the umbrum free. Chrysalis opposes this plan, saying the umbrum are vicious monsters and that there will be no emotions for the changelings to feed on if they are freed. With opposition from both Sombra and Hope, however, Chrysalis is forced to go along with it.

Written by: Jeremy Whitley 
Artwork by: Andy Price

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friendship-Is-Magic-36/digital-comic/310092?ref=c2l0ZS9saXN0L2Rlc2t0b3AvZ3JpZExpc3QvSXNzdWVz

Friendship is magic #37 

Some time after the previous issue, the umbrum have completely taken over the Crystal Empire, and the captured Twilight and Cadance are brought before "Emperor" Sombra to be sentenced. The umbrum demand the location of the rest of the Mane Six, who Twilight and Cadance helped escape, but they refuse to talk. When the umbrum use Shining Armor as a bargaining chip, Cadance reveals that Twilight's friends are in a remote place called Canterine. Despite Cadance's compliance, Sombra turns Shining Armor to stone

Written by: Jeremy Whitley 

Artwork by: Andy Price

Download link : https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friendship-Is-Magic-37/digital-comic/317651?ref=c2VyaWVzL3ZpZXcvZGVza3RvcC9ncmlkTGlzdC9Jc3N1ZXM

******************************************************

Due to colder weather we will be meeting at the Atrium rather than the usual place in Central Park.

601 Lexington Ave – Btw. 52nd & 53rd Street – Take the 6 train to 51st Street. The building itself is actually connected to the 53rd Street E/M/6 MTA subway station and is one of New York's largest skyscrapers.

results.description:
Learn & Sweat Bhangra sessions are for you 

- if you want to energize after a long work day

- if you love to sweat it out to heart pumping music

- if you think fitness doesn't mean just lifting weights

- if you want to learn and groove to energetic Bhangra while burning serious cals.

The class begins with a warm up, high energy and high fun, this Bhangra class combines the strong, festive moves of traditional Bhangra dance with a follow-me fitness-class style. 

Each week participants also have the opportunity to learn a more in-depth piece of Bhangra choreography to a popular dance floor hit. 

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our other BEGINNER BHANGRA classes too!
results.name: Learn & Sweat BHANGRA

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, May 25th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The new session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (May 25th - June 15th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (May 25th - June 15th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (May 24th - June 14th) at Adelante Studios. Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.
results.name: Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino Classes!

-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 classes: ONLY $60 - That's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.


*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video links of our group doing Rueda de Casino:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class on Wednesdays at 8:30pm, immediately following the beginner class.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (May 25th - June 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (starting May 24th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

results.description:
Celebrate the Sun’s transit into Gemini with gentle harmonious movement of eurythmy. Some have called this movement art “social yoga” and “social tai chi”.


Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle, led by Soulful Wizardess Marta Stemberger. We’ll move gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry.


Register early at http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
Space allows only up to 12 people.
$18 paid in advance via PayPal with credit or debit card
$20 at the door (cash only) if there is room.


* * * * *


The Sun enters the constellation of Gemini on May 20. The yellow Twins offer humanity the gift of the consonant H as it sounds in “happy” and in “human”. Now is the time to let go, be free, and shine.

• Move some gentle harmonious movement exercises to live piano music and beautiful poetry


• Experience the fascinating unity of people moving together in a eurythmy circle 

• Learn to move the eurythmy gestures for the consonant H and its different sounds in “happy” and in “human”, the vowel I (pronounced “ee”), and the music interval of the 7th

* * * * * 

Open to all who can walk. No prior movement experience is needed. We’ll simply breathe and flow in harmony with the sound and each other.

Please wear loose fitting clothes with long-sleeved tops and long loose pants or skirts. The tops should allow you to freely move arms all the way up, and still cover your belly area. We’ll move barefoot. No slippery socks or footwear please.


* * * * *
For more info visit and to register visit http://ssi.hamoves.net/eurythmy-circles/.
results.name: BE FREE AND SHINE: Eurythmy Circle of Social Yoga, Social Tai Chi, Sacred Dance

PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS CLASS IS FULL. A NEW CLASS WILL BE FORMING FOR JANUARY 2017. 

Dearest Beloveds,

I am deeply honored and grateful to share this 10 month journey of The Path Of Love with each of you.

The Path of Love opens you to the energy of creation and calls to you to open your heart gateway to your eternal self so that you may begin to anchor all that you are upon the Earth in unconditional love and open embrace of your Divinity.

This is the creation dreaming path where you enter the void and begin to access your highest potential through an open heart. It is here that you begin to see all the possibilities that are open for you and know that each choice you make brings you close to your divine power.

It is a deep path of self discovery where all is illuminated and you are called to embrace and honour yourself deeply. The Path of Love is the road home to all that you are.

Much Love and Gratitude,

Julie

The Path Of Love course was channeled by Ishtar, an embodied Ascended Master channel from Australia. Please visit her website: by clicking here

"Be the change you wish to see in the world". ~~ Ghandi

Forty°North seems to hover above the Hudson!

The views in all directions, with the Palisades directly in front of you, Manhattan gleaming to the south and the river itself opening up to the north, are extraordinary.

Housed above the Tennis Club of Hastings, right on the Hudson, Forty°North has exceptional views of the river.


There will be DRINK SPECIALS for us!

(Actual view from Forty°North)


THERE ARE MANY MORE MEMBERS COMING FROM OTHER GROUPS, HERE'S ONE OF THEM........  http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-Singles/events/231151415/


AND FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS.

PARKING

When you go down the ramp onto River Street, 40 North is on the left. And on the left you'll see parking signs that read, "3 Hour Parking". Those spots are Free Parking for all. Do Not park in the spots on the right that read, 'Permit Parking".



And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.


Looking forward to seeing everyone!

Bob

results.description:
This month, Fuzz Productions will be hosting us at their building in Williamsburg. They will be providing pizza, beer and non-alcoholic beverages.

Lessons Learned from Building Type-Safe Request Routing in Swift

Since the announcement of the open sourcing of Swift at WWDC and the promise of Linux support, developers have been working on building web frameworks for Swift. In this talk, Grant Butler takes on one portion of a web framework, request routing, by leveraging Swift’s powerful type system. He’ll also touch upon some of the work arounds and tricks he discovered while building this web framework component.


Bio: Grant Butler is an iOS developer at The New York Times. He currently writes Objective-C and Swift for the Crossword app for iPhone and iPad, and previously worked on NYT Now, an aggregate news app with the most important stories of the day.


Objective-C U L8R: A Swift Transition

As a mobile agency, Prolific Interactive builds and maintains many apps at once. Since the introduction of Swift 2, they've launched 5 greenfield projects entirely in Swift, integrated it into the rest of their legacy code, and launched several open source projects. In this talk, Paul Miard will be showing off what they've learned about bringing a team up to speed, getting stakeholders on board, and writing production-quality code in a brand new language.

Bio: Paul Miard is the Lead iOS Engineer at Prolific Interactive. In his three years at the company, he's worked on apps for a variety of major brands, as well as leading iOS standards and practices initiatives for the team.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the wooden gate on Roebling St. just south of Metropolitan Av.
results.name: Objective-C U L8R: A Swift Transition / Type-Safe Request Routing in Swift

...If, then, the maya or unreality lies not in the physical world but in the concepts or thought forms by which it is described, it is clear that maya refers to social institutions-to language and logic and their constructs-and to the way [ways] in which they modify our feeling[s] of the world ["of the world" is unnecessary.]  ~Alan Watts

results.description:
We had a great suggestion last time to do some time-series algorithms! The first suggestion was to go into an R package for estimating properties of stochastic differential equations using pseudo- maximum likelihood methods. There are lots of nice details here:
https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/Sim.DiffProc/vignettes/FitSDE.pdf

We'll split this into two meetings. The first will be going into some of the theory, so we understand what is going on in the package (e.g. What is pMLE? What are the different models that are implemented? What are the assumptions and limitations?). The second (to be scheduled afterward) will be going into some practical examples of how to use the package.

Feel free to post extra resources that you find useful in the comments!

Usual Disclaimer:

We're a very informal group! None of us are necessarily experts on the material we're covering, but we're all interested in learning more about it.  Our goal is to pick something interesting to read about, then come together and benefit from each others' knowledge and experience.
results.name: SDE Estimation with PMLE

results.description:
THE COSMIC COCKTAIL: Three Parts Dark Matter - Dr. Katherine Freese

The ordinary atoms that make up the known universe constitute only 5 percent of all matter and energy in the cosmos. The rest is known as dark matter and dark energy, because their precise identities are unknown. Theorists contend that dark matter consists of fundamental particles known as WIMPs , or weakly interacting massive particles. Billions of them pass through our bodies every second without us realizing it, yet their gravitational pull is capable of whirling stars and gas at breakneck speeds around the centers of galaxies, and bending light. 

The Cosmic Cocktail is the inside story of the epic quest to solve one of the most compelling enigmas of modern science—what is the universe made of?—told by one of today’s foremost pioneers in the study of dark matter, acclaimed University of Michigan theoretical physicist Katherine Freese. 

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: Great Lectures on DVD: The Cosmic Cocktail

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:00 to 8:30 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
We're very happy to have John Allspaw, CTO of Etsy and author, presenting on Common Ground and Coordination in Joint Activity by Klein, Feltovich, and Woods.

Intro 

The paper I'm going to discuss is the result of what happens when people with backgrounds in mathematics, psychology, and artificial intelligence (Feltovich and Bradshaw) get together to ask questions about how teams operate alongside the originators of modern decision-making and cognitive systems engineering research (Klein and Woods). 

The concepts outlined in the paper have provided frames and directions in designing tools and environments where successful work requires multiple actors (whether they are people or software agents!) to succeed. This seminal paper takes a deep dive into not just people and teamwork, but what comprises the sometimes invisible activity of coordination, collaboration, cooperation, and the contracts and expectations entities have with each other along the way. 

The paper has had far-reaching influence in multiple domains: military intelligence, space transportation and aviation, and more recently: software engineering and operations on the web. Let me walk you through where this paper came from, what makes this paper critical to the future of software, and a hint about what I'm sure it means about the future. 


Bio

John Allspaw (@allspaw) is Etsy’s Chief Technology Officer (CTO), leading the Product Engineering, Infrastructure and Operations teams. Previously, he was SVP of Infrastructure and Operations at Etsy. For over 17 years, he has worked in system operations in the biotech, government and online media industries.


He began his career running vehicle crash simulations for the U.S. government. In 1997, he made the leap to the web, building the technical infrastructures at Salon, InfoWorld, Friendster and Flickr.

John is the author of The Art of Capacity Planning and Web Operations: Keeping the Data On Time, both published by O’Reilly Media. He holds a BS from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst, and an MSC from Lund University.


------------------------------------------------------------------------

TwoSigma - Platinum Sponsor of the New York chapter

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Details

Doors open at 7 pm; the presentation will begin at 7:30 pm; and, yes, there will be refreshments of all kinds and pizza.

A little different than previous PWLs, you'll have to check-in with security with your Name/ID. Definitely sign-up if you’re going to attend–unfortunately people whose names aren’t entered into the security system in advance won’t be allowed in. 

After John presents the paper, we will open up the floor to discussion and questions.  

We hope that you'll read the paper before the meetup, but don't stress if you can't. If you have any questions, thoughts, or related information, please visit #pwlnyc on slack, our GitHub repository, where you can also find the paper, or add to the discussion on this event's thread.

Additionally, if you have any papers you want to add to the repository above (papers that you love!), please send us a pull request. Also, if you have any ideas/questions about this meetup or the Papers-We-Love org, just open up an issue.

results.description:
Join us for an evening of Shamanic/Empathic Healing and what's really going on in 2016 with Gary!

Gary is a Shamanic/Empathic Healer as well as a Reiki Master, MBA/RMT. He is also a published author, "Surgeon of the Soul - Stories of Hope and Healing."

2016 is the year of the great shift which will help each of us to move into a grander awareness and acceptance of our true selves... but it's not the energies of the times alone that will push us forward; we also have to help ourselves by clearing/releasing the energies and experiences of our past that keeps us from moving ahead.

Shamanic/Empathic Healing is a "body centered therapy" that allows us to clear negative energies and traumatic experiences at their source in a highly effective manner. This process sometimes been described as "therapy on speed."

In this presentation, Gary will explain what Shamanic/Empathic Healing is, how it works and how it can benefit you. He will also giving mini-healings on  members who wish to experience this modality for themselves. Gary has over 20 years experience utilizing this approach with his clients.

$5.00 per person.

Full title:How do you run an electronic trading business and what do you need in place to be an algorithmic market maker

Abstract: Examining the electronic trading business from a practitioner’s perspective. This business has undergone many changes in recent years due to the emergence of new hardware and software products, the development of new quantitative and computational techniques, and changes in market structure and regulations. A market maker needs to be agile in order to remain competitive. This synoptic talk briefly considers the various factors that come into a market maker’s business calculus.

Speaker: Dr Paul A. Bilokon is Director at Deutsche Bank, where he runs the global credit and core quant teams, part of Markets Electronic Trading (MET) group. He is one of the pioneers of electronic trading in credit, including indices, single names, and cash, and has worked in e-trading, derivatives pricing, and quantitative finance at bulge bracket institutions, including Morgan Stanley, Lehman Brothers, Nomura, and Citigroup. His more than a decade-long career spans many asset classes: equities, FX spot and options, rates and credit.


Paul was educated at Christ Church, Oxford, and Imperial College. The domain-theoretic framework for continuous-time stochastic processes, developed with Prof. Abbas Edalat, earned him a PhD degree and a prestigious LICS paper. Paul's other academic interests include stochastic filtering and machine learning. He is an expert developer in C++, Java, Python, and kdb+/q, with a special interest in high performance scientific computing.

His interests in philosophy and finance led him to formulate the vision for and found Thalesians, a think tank of dedicated professionals working in quant finance, economics, mathematics, physics and computer science, the focal point of a community with over 1,500 members worldwide. He serves as its CEO, and runs it with two of his friends and colleagues, Saeed Amen and Matthew Dixon, as fellow Directors.

Dr. Bilokon is a joint winner of the Donald Davis Prize (2005), winner of the British Computing Society Award for the Student Making the Best Use of IT (World Leadership Forum's SET award, 2005), Ward Foley Memorial Scholarship (2001), two University of London High Achiever Awards (in mathematics and physics, 1999); a Member of the British Computer Society, Institution of Engineering and Technology, and European Complex Systems Society; Associate of the Securities and Investment Institute, and Royal College of Science; and a frequent speaker at premier conferences such as Global Derivatives, alphascope, LICS, and Domains.
results.name: Seminar (London) - Paul Bilokon - How to run electronic market making business?

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely "run in the dark" with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles.

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here.

Special equipment: Headlamp or small flashlight (winter months)

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. If the weather is warm, I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
Healing Circle Ritual is an opportunity to come together in community to align for spiritual connection and growth. Bring your mental, emotional and physical bodies into balance. Let go of unhealthy patterns, send healing to places in need, and open yourself to receive Divine Love. Bodily weaknesses are strengthened through breath work and vibrating healing sound currents.

You will breathe, move, meditate and groove ending with a 15 minute ‘gong bath’.

This 1-1/2 hr workshop integrates thousands of years of ancient wisdom with Kundalini Yoga as taught by Yogi Bhajan, which will shift your perception quickly into the force of love, and illuminate your radiance, so you can attract your hearts deepest desires.

The gong is one of the oldest musical instruments in the world. Based on ancient wisdom, the gongs vibrate at the same frequency as the body allowing the body to heal itself.


Time: 7:45-9:15 pm     Fee: $20


Please come in 15 minutes earlier so we can all be signed up and ready to start. You can also sign up online to make it easier: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/ASP/home.asp?studioid=299


**Bring a Yoga Mat, Blanket and Bottle of Water to class. Wear loose comfortable clothing made with natural fibers.
results.name: Healing Circle

results.description:
Come join our class with instruction. Every class includes exercises to improve your drawings, and help you see and understand the figure better, as well as a lot of drawing from the nude. We'll include both very basic and advanced topics, based on what the students in class are doing (that's you).

Some of the topics we frequently cover include:
--Proportion
--Foreshortening
--Shading
--Anatomy
--Perspective
--Different ways of seeing the figure
--Materials and their influence on how you draw
And much more!


Because it's a small class, there's a lot of personalized attention, but no pressure. If there's something specific you'd like to work on this is a great place to explore it, and if you're not sure what's blocking you this is probably the place where we'll find it and fix it!

Bring your own art supplies, and lets make some magic!

Note we'll be in Studio D, 11th floor

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is FREE.  There is a suggested donation of $10, completely optional, to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 8:30-10:30pm (FREE)
