results.description:
PLEASE TEXT rsvp[masked] - Cathy

MID PARK BEHIND REC CENTER @ HANDBALL COURTS (MAP ON THIS LINK) https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness/photos/gm.383293988527791/596413443794335/?type=1&theater


NO ONE UPTOWN OFFERS POUND - this is a great opportunity to try a "NEW" FUN and different Calorie torching work out!!!


645am-715am - Pound Rock Out Work out - total body

you will need to bring, 

Yourself, Sneakers, comfortable clothes.

At least one water bottle (trust me, you’ll need it!) and a towel for all that sweat. If you have one, a heart rate monitor is an awesome fitness tool that instructors and students alike typically use to measure exercise intensity during classes. 

You may want gloves, & a Mat as we are going to get down and dirty, pullups, push ups, planks, knee tucks, Dragon push ups, hand walks, etc... so dress accordingly and get excited to have some fun while shaping up!!!.

WHY POUND? in shape magazine April 21 http://www.shape.com/fitness/workouts/15-next-big-fitness-trends

POUND is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 400 and 900+ calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique – all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Through continual upper body motion using our lightly weighted drumsticks, called Ripstix™, you'll turn into a calorie-torching drummer, POUNDing off pounds as each song flies by. Rock, rap, dubstep, pop and old school music fuse to create the POUNDtrack series, which is hand-selected by music enthusiasts, drummers and POUND founders Kirsten Potenza and Cristina Peerenboom.

GET RIPPED WITH RIPSTIX™

What would a drumming workout be without drumsticks? We’ve invented unique, lightly weighted exercise drumsticks that have been specially designed to get you ripped — hence the name: Ripstix™

Twice the weight of a standard drumstick (¼ lb each) and slightly shorter in length, Ripstix are designed to maximize your workout by alter the physics of your arm movement to burn more calories

IT WORKS.

POUND combines easy to follow (and not complex or embarrassing) cardio moves with strength training and drumming. This combo works the entire body, raises the heart rate to a fat-burning zone, and forces each move to be as precise as a basic beat.

Each 2-4 minute song is carefully calibrated with interval peaks and extended fat burning sequences, providing you with the best workout in the shortest span of time. After you’re done rocking out to the 45-minute POUNDtrack, you’ll have done 15,000 reps, performed over 30 extended interval peaks, and zipped through over 70 techniques without even realizing it

I am offering 1 week free, then a 15.00 contribution to workout material is appreciated per week.

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! 7AM Casual Study @ Starbucks

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group

We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!
results.how_to_find_us: It's 7am, you'll see us!
results.name: Bi-Weekly Business Networking Group

results.description: As a member, our model offers opportunities to showcase your business, make presentations about what you do & visit members' businesses so it will be easy to promote each other's services.  LeTip has been successfully helping its members put dollars in their pocket for since 1978.  Our group is fun, friendly and committed to grow.  You are invited to join us for 2 complimentary breakfast meetings to help you evaluate if the group is right for you.  Hope you chose to join us.

results.description:
What's more fun than exploring algorithms first thing in the morning? Grab a cup of Joe from downstairs and meet us upstairs we'll be digging into a favorite algorithm

using any of our favorite (or not-yet favorite) languages. This is a great way to do two things at once: learn more about an algorithm and get the added bonus of seeing how different languages approach the same problem. So lets: sort and parse, hash and search, match and test, together. some implementations of: Karger's Minimum Cut

Test data can be found here:

https://github.com/nlangnyc/algorithms/tree/master/karger_minimum_cut


More details:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karger%27s_algorithm

Join the #algorithms channel in our slack team for even more details:

http://nlang-slack-inviter.herokuapp.com/
results.name: Early Morning Algorithms with the N-Lang gang

Thursdays of each month (except when there is a holiday) from 8-9:30AM we conduct our presentations, networking and business development meetings for entrepreneurs, consultants, salespeople and business owners in the NY Tri-state area. One catch – YOU bring your own coffee :-) (I will bring the bagels.)

Schedule for 2016

Bfast @AXA: 8-9:30AM

Happy Hour @Fatcat Billiards or Ainsworth Park 6-8PM

May 12, 19 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 26

June 9, 16 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 23

July 14, 21 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 28

August 11, 18 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 25

September 8, 15 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 22

October 13, 20 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 27

November 10, 17 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 24

December 8, 15 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 22

We are much more than your average meetup group. We act as your own private business advisory council and potential funding pool. Members and attendees walk out each week with sound business advice, decades worth of experience, leads and introductions.

What is an entrepreneurs breakfast /business networking and development meeting? A meeting where you present your demo, meet various people from various industries and walk out with introductions, leads and referrals and business cards. Curious how do we do this? Come on down and find out...

AXA Advisors is located at: 1290 Ave of the Americas (bet 51 - 52nd St.) 
4th floor (Always check with security)

We charge $25.00 for all meetings ($20 via paypal if you RSVP early) unless you become a member at $500/year. (Your first meeting is free if you just want to check it out). Please bring business cards and your own coffee. ($20 payment here through paypal: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA)

If you are interested in joining, please RSVP here. Please contact Raphi Salem at [masked] or call[masked] if you have any questions.

We are part of 5 meetup groups. Please check them out and join: 
http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Serious-Entrepreneurs-Only-Present-Get-Funded/

results.description:
A "design sprint" (invented by Google Ventures) is a 5-phase workshop which uses design thinking, to reduce the inherent risks in successfully bringing products, services or websites to market. Design thinking combines empathy, creativity and rationality to solve human-centered problems. It is the foundation on which a Design Sprint is built. 

At this workshop, you will participate in a design sprint focused on the design and planning phases of building a mobile website. 

You will also have time to network and build relationships with other entrepreneurs and small businesses, while enjoying delicious coffee and pastries by Seven Grams Caffe.
results.name: Mobile Website Design Workshop

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
The Worthy Women's Entrepreneurial Seminar Series is where professional women go to Learn, Connect & Grow.  

The Worthy Women's Network (aka The Sisterhood) is a diverse group of women entrepreneurs (and aspiring) who understand the value of educating ourselves as entrepreneurs and developing ourselves as women.  Through the seminar series, "The Woman & Her Business" women participate in bi-weekly seminars on a wide range of personal and entrepreneurial subject matters. Most importantly, women learn the art of 'keeping all the balls in the air' while being a successful entrepreneur. 

At Worthy Women, we understand the difficulty in being a modern woman and thus prepare women for this journey.  Our empowering Sisterhood offers a source of support from other women who 'have been there done that' (some wrote a book about it), opportunites to market / promote your products & services and education that keeps you in business -- while building your confidence and resilience as a woman, mom, wife or partner.

We aren't a networking group, we're a Sisterhood!  

We meet on the 2nd and 4th Thursday of each month, January - June and September-December.  

Our Spring 2016 series begins Thurs. Jan 14, 2016. 

We meet at: 

Greek Taverna Restaurant

292 Bloomfield Avenue

Montclair, NJ  07042

To register for a seminar, or view the listing of our upcoming topics visit http://www.lvpnj.com/2016-worthy-womens-seminars.html

Our seminars are FREE FOR FIRST TIME GUEST!  All you'll spend is $15 for menu lunch. The afternoon includes lunch, seminar, raffles, snacks, networking and a good time with like minded women.  We are a membership network so you'll only be able to attend a single session one time before we ask for a membership commitment of any level.

If you have any questions, please email Valerie Austin, our Booking Manager at [masked].

We hope to see you soon! 

LaTia
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.lvpnj.com/2016-worthy-womens-seminars.html

results.description:
RESISTER HERE


Learn Lighting Posing and Filters for Beauty Photography!


Beauty photography is a subset of fashion and requires a certain precision in lighting to master.


Join Daniel Norton OnSet as he walks you through the process of lighting the face to create great images right out of the camera.

While ALL beauty photos recieve extensive retouching, to maintain a client a photographer must deliver as close to perfect an image out of camera as possible.

Learn: What types of lighting work best for beauty
Learn: How to achieve accurate color in your photos
Learn: How filtration on the lens can help cut down on retouching


There will be three sessions, each covering different set-ups. Sign up for one or all!
12pm, 2pm and 4pm


Daniel Norton is the Creative Director for Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.
results.name: READY FREE DEMO! OnSet: Beauty Photography

Let me know by Tuesday (5/24) by 9:00 AM if you want to play. I’ll then make reservations and let everyone who signed up to play know the exact time of the reservation. Hopefully, I can get right around 1:00. ... 5/24 UPDATE: TEE TIME MADE FOR 3 AT 1:36


I’ll make reservations if we get three or more people. If we get 5 people I’ll just take the first four who signed up since a 3 – 2 split of players is not as enjoyable. ... 5/24 UPDATE: CONTACT ME IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO JOIN US AS A FOURTH PLAYER. I'LL PROBABLY BE ABLE TO ADD YOU To our threesome. A FOURSOME WOULD BE NICE TO HAVE.

Note: I’m trying to simplify the signup. Thus I’m NOT doing the two-step process I’ve used in the recent past (of first doing a tentative headcount before making definite tee time reservations). … Thus if you reply “yes, I’m coming” to this notice it is your firm commitment to coming.

Thursday's weather is supposed to be glorious: a high of 88 and sunny.


Any questions please ask.

Hill Rose

results.description:
Meet at 4:00 pm.

Ride at 4:15 pm

IF A SECOND GROUP WANTS TO MEET LATER, perhaps someone can volunteer to lead a second group.  Please post through comments.

Meet at small parking lot off of College Road (University Drive.)

Intermediate level ride; no beginners please.

Most fun trails are unmarked.  Ride is not super fast. May ride to the top depending upon group.

Map of Park: http://www.wpunj.edu/dotAsset/325914.pdf

Park Website: http://www.nynjtc.org/park/high-mountain-park-preserve

A description from mtbNJ "with lots of loose rock, and rock garden too and lots of climbing, lesser flowy trails hence the rocks. This trails will make you hate or love. There's some nice single track too."

Note:  Can get there from Hamburg Tpk in Wayne to University Drive  at a light (Turn left) or

From 287 to Route 208 S, Take Ewing Ave Exit and travel S to T (stop sign), Turn L onto High Mt Road.  Stay on High Mt Road to fork, keep right to stay on High Mt Road.   At next traffic light, make a right.  At stop sign, this is College Road, turn right.  Parking lot is up a ways on the right.

results.description:
Venue: Atlantic City

Google I/O happens in Mountain View from May 18-20. Every year GDG New York traditionally does an I/O "Recap" event the week after I/O. This year, we will have that and more.

AGENDA

5:00 pm   DOORS OPEN

5:30 pm   Welcome (Ralph & Nitya)

• Google IO 2016 "Highlights" 


• GDG Announcements & Review of IO Requests 

6:00 pm   #Ask Firebase: Post I/O Live Hangout with James Tamplin (Co-founder, Firebase) and Magnus Hyttsten (Developer Advocate, Firebase) #AskFirebaseLive

7:00 pm  Firebase & Firebase-UI Q&A with Frank Van Puffelen, Developer Advocate @Firebase (and core contributor to Firebase-UI Android)

7:30pm Progressive Web Apps Q&A with Jeffrey Posnick, Open Web Platform, Developer Relations @Google)

8:00pm   Lightning Talk

• Sara Morsi: Android Instant Apps

• Allen Firstenberg (GDE, Wearables): Google Home, Google Assistant and the future of Ubiquitous Computing. 

• Eric Roffman: "VR, AR & MR @Google IO16: An indie developer's perspective" -- will cover Tango, Cardboard, YouTube and other Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality and Mixed Reality announcements.

• Lisa Wray (Google Developer Expert, Android) Android Highlights @Google IO16 and AndroidTools Demo

• Ralph Yozzo**: Firebase Queues (Discussion & Demo)


• Nitya Narasimhan**: Web Updates (Polymer App Toolbox, Chrome DevTools, Offline-First)

• Allen Firstenberg (GDE, Wearables): Google Sheets, Google Slides, and Google Classroom: Changes to eliminate cut and paste

9:00pm DOORS CLOSE



** May cover these in welcome segment if sufficient audience exists, and give others more time)
results.name: Google I/O Extended (GDG New York Edition)

Manhattanites and others who reside in greater New York City! Come enjoy some casual Magic the Gathering gameplay in a casual environment. Whether you are new to the game or an experienced player, this is a great time for all. As with our Sunday Funday meetup, there will be some pre-made decks for those who don't currently own but feel free to bring your own along if you want (Commander aka EDH, Modern, Standard, etc.). And invite friends ... the more the merrier.

IMPORTANT!!!: There is a MANDATORY required purchase of $10 in order to remain at Bread and Butter. This is the deal worked out with the owner. We will be in a much more centrally located area with more access to more subway lines.
results.name: Mid-week Magic MADNESS in Manhattan (well not really that mad)

group.name: I'd Tap That - NYC Chapter (Casual Magic the Gathering)

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

This month, we will be meeting in a smaller venue at Microsoft and will be focusing our discussion on 3d modeling and VR content. 

 We are extremely excited to welcome Alban Denoyel, co-founder of Sketchfab. 

Sketchfab is the leading platform to publish and find 3D and VR content, anywhere online. They are building for 3D content what YouTube did for video: they provide the best 3D player and are the fastest growing 3D and VR repository. Sketchfab integrates with all major 3D creation tools and publishing platforms, and is the 3D publishing partner of Adobe Photoshop, Facebook, Microsoft HoloLens and Intel RealSense.

Sketchfab also just released a new VR app and WebVR support as of 5/17/16.  Please see details in the link below.

https://blog.sketchfab.com/announcing-sketchfab-vr-apps-webvr-support/

https://sketchfab.com/virtual-reality

As always, please feel free to bring any projects that you are working on and interested in sharing with the group.

results.description:
6pm-6:30pm - arrive, networking

6:30pm-7:30pm - In this talk, Brenden will discuss techniques for achieving continuous, zero-downtime deployments on Mesosphere's DC/OS with Marathon. For services which serve front-facing client requests, it's critically important to be able to deploy new versions of services without experiencing downtime. This talk will also discuss techniques such as rolling deployments, blue/green deployments, and canary deployments.

James Morelli of ShopKeep will also give a short talk on his motivations and experience with performing zero-downtime deployments with Marathon.

Bio:

Brenden Matthews is a Software Architect at Mesosphere who works closely with customers and engineering. He ensures technical goals are aligned with customer needs. Previously, he was a software engineer at Airbnb, running Airbnb’s analytics stack. He is an Apache Mesos contributor, the primary maintainer for Marathon-lb, Chronos, Storm, and Hadoop on Mesos, and has contributed to numerous related frameworks such as Spark and Marathon. Previously he's given talks about Mesos at QCon, MesosCon, Twitter, and Ericsson.

7:30m-8:00pm - tbd - hold for open sourcing new streaming scheduler for Mesos
results.name: Zero-downtime deployments using DC/OS and Marathon

Join us for a Meetup at Microsoft focused on Shopify eCommerce and how to launch your eCommerce website fast. In this presentation, we’ll cover:


• Creating your account - signing up & pricing 

• Settings (Payments, Checkout, Shipping, Taxes, etc.)


• Design/Theme (header, footer, fonts, colors, etc.)

• Creating categories, products & pages


• Extending your site with add-ons


• Other considerations to launching your eCommerce business (time permitting)


     • Setting Goals (key performance indicators (KPI's))

     • Naming your business & buying domains

     • Launch Promotion And Strategy

     • Social networks

     • Email marketing


     • Landing page


     • Google Analytics


     • SEO & Keywords


Seating is limited, please reserve your spot today!


Schedule


• 6:00 - Doors open for Networking on the third floor theatre

• 6:30 - 30 second introductions from all our members

• 6:45 - Presentation

• 7:45 - Q&A

• 8:00 - Networking


Location


• Microsoft Theater @ 677 5th Ave 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10022


About the Group


The purpose of this group is to help one another create develop, design and promote highly effective eCommerce websites. All are welcomed and meetups will be focus on three types of sessions: 

• Talks - Short talks about important website and eCommerce topics 

• Reviews - Interactive sessions in which the group will review member websites and provide feedback 

• Training - Introductory sessions on site planning, design, development as well as on-going promotion and maintenance. 



About our Presenter

Dean Pagliaro is an eCommerce director with 15+ years of experience. He is a trusted authority to tech startups, small, mid-market and enterprise industry-leading companies. He serves as a strategic advisor to agencies and helps B2B and B2C companies define and execute all essential components of their strategy- eCommerce conversion, design, technology, operations, and marketing.

Dean has worked with some of the largest retailers in the metro area. During his tenure at two New York City firms, and as founder of an eCommerce consultancy, he has experience in a vast array of industries including: health & beauty, food, apparel, consumer electronics, housewares, toys and jewelry.
results.name: Introduction to Shopify: How to Launch your eCommerce Website Fast!

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!...then bar party with everyone!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

results.description:
The Hatchery opens its doors to a fast paced New York style pitch event.

Hatchery style honesty. In ways others may be too polite to share. It's what you need to hear about your startup, covering marketing, finance, technology, business, presentation, and more.

Investors:   

Presenters:   

What's the point?

1. Pitching practice
2. Honest feedback about your company

How it works:

1. RSVP to attend

2. We accept pitches on a rolling basis and select five companies to pitch at each AYS event. We strongly advise that you attend an event prior to submitting your pitch

3. If you would like to pitch, send materials in advance to: [masked]
- we need PowerPoint and executive summary
- deadline is 1 week before the event
- file naming: company name (1 word), underscore, deck or summary
ex. hatchery_deck.ppt, hatchery_summary.doc
- put both documents in 1 email, do not send separately

4. We will not wait for the guests to arrive. Doors open at 6pm. The event begins  at 6:30pm and ends at 8:30pm.

5. It will be FAST!

6. There is no Q&A. We can talk after the event.

Format:
5 minute entrepreneur pitch
5 minute panel critique

The Powerpoint:
Please address all of these eleven points in your slides:
1. your team
2. what your product/service does
3. what issue/pain is it looking to solve/address
4. what is the solution
5. what is the addressable market
6. what is the competitive landscape
7. any current customer/client/pilot pipeline
8. what is the revenue stream/source
9. what are your financial projections
10. how much are you looking for in investment
11. what will you do with the money, how will it be spent

Entrepreneurs who take this seriously will absolutely benefit.

Advance tickets $10; Day of $20; At door $20

results.description:
Thursday, May 26, 2016 from 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM New York Love Story, an exhibition by photographer Karsten Staiger, invites you to share the artist’s love and ode to New York City by experiencing the magical moments he has captured over the past ten years. It is a place the German-born photographer has called home for more than a decade.

New York Love Story evolved out of Staiger’s desire to approach New York from new perspectives and spectacular heights. He has embarked on a journey to create a beautifully photographed, expansive collection of exceptionally high resolution large format photographs of New York City, while simultaneously documenting the entire process with still photography and video.

From New York City’s highest rooftops, balconies, penthouses and window washing rigs, he chased those fleeting instants leading to the most exciting shots – the perfect balance between the cityscape below and the sky above. The extraordinary shifts in weather unfolding in front of his lens quickly became an obsession for Staiger to capture the natural beauty of the city.

A long time artist and commercial photographer, Staiger's understanding of complex lighting and technology, coupled with his fascination of aerial views eventually led him to shift his focus from shooting to advertising campaigns to the skylines of New York City.

About Karsten Staiger

Like countless others before him, German-born photographer Karsten Staiger is in love with New York City. As an artist and commercial photographer for more than a decade, Staiger has built his career shooting advertising campaigns for luxury brands and corporations (Hugo Boss, DeBeers, Nextel, Time Warner Cable, among others) in his Chelsea studio. Staiger was at the forefront of the digital revolution that emerged in the 90s; since then he has been a pioneer in utilizing cutting-edge camera technology to create elegant images in extremely high resolution. This led him to turn his eye to the New York City skyline that evolved into his latest exhibit, New York Love Story.
RSVP

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/new-york-love-story-exhibition-opening-tickets-24852161484

results.description:
For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely vid of myself. If you don't see it and the other images on this page then you are probably using the Meetup app or a mobile browser. Worry not :) simply click on the Vimeo link below, then study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus look for me hovering near the entrance of the first gallery.

https://vimeo.com/161663358

One last piece of business.

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said you are always welcome to buy me a post-hop bourbon. Or just click the 'chip in' button if you are dying to offset my monthly $20 organizer fee. But let me reiterate, contributions while appreciated are not required.

And now the openings...

results.description:
We would like to welcome guests to attend the Manhattan Toastmasters' General Meeting. You will get to experience awesome speeches by our Manhattan Toastmasters Club members as well gain some experience speaking in front of a group. 

Our meetings are divided into three sections. The first section consists of project speeches, delivered by our Club Members. The second section features Table Topics, where Club Members and Guests get a chance to practice impromptu speaking. The third section includes Evaluations when the project speakers receive constructive feedback from the evaluators. 

Come and join us for our General meeting and take the first step in improving your public speaking skills, gain confidence and make new friends who will support and encourage you.

AFTER-PARTY immediately after the meeting. After-party location will be announced at the meeting.

results.description:
Additional registration at Eventbrite REQUIRED!

Note: This is an exhibition opening with reception (free drinks & snacks available) at the German Consulate. This event is not exclusive to our group. Please follow the Consulate's rules for registration. The consulate has staff members on-site that can help & assist you.


After finishing your RSVP here, please proceed to

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/new-york-love-story-exhibition-opening-tickets-24852161484


immediately to secure your spot. The Consulate's registration will close as soon as capacity is reached for this event.

New York Love Story by Karsten Staiger

Official page: http://www.newyorklovestory.com/

About the exhibition

New York Love Story evolved out of Staiger’s desire to approach New York from new perspectives and spectacular heights. He has embarked on a journey to create a beautifully photographed, expansive collection of exceptionally high-resolution large format photographs of New York City, while simultaneously documenting the entire process with still photography and video. He invites you to share some of the magical moments he has captured over the past ten years from his bird’s eye view. It is his ode to New York City.


About the artist

Like countless others before him, German-born photographer Karsten Staiger is in love with New York City. As an artist and commercial photographer in New York City for over a decade, Staiger has built his career shooting advertising campaigns for luxury brands and corporations (Hugo Boss, DeBeers, Nextel, among others) in his Chelsea studio. Staiger was at the forefront of the digital revolution that emerged in the 1990s, and since then he has been a pioneer in utilizing cutting-edge camera technology to create elegant images in extremely high resolution. Staiger’s deep understanding of complex lighting and technology, coupled with his fascination with aerial views eventually led him to turn his eye to New York City’s skyline. The extraordinary shifts in weather unfolding in front of his lens quickly became an obsession. From New York City’s highest rooftops, balconies, penthouses and private planes, Staiger chased those fleeting instants leading to the most exciting shots– the perfect balance between the cityscape below and the sky above.


Ongoing Exhibition:

Thursday, May 26th, 2016 – Friday, July 1st, 2016

Opening hours: Monday – Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Admission is free.


Opening reception:

Thursday, May 26th, 2016 from 6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.


Admission

Admission is free for this event, but your registration at 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/new-york-love-story-exhibition-opening-tickets-24852161484


 is required to gain access.

How do I get there by subway?

6: 51st St

4/5/6/7: Grand Central Terminal

E/M: Lexington Av/53rd St

Since the event is near 1st Ave & 49th St, there is going to be a bit of a walk involved, keep that in mind for your timing & check google maps for details. 


As always - please change your RSVP status if your plans change. We appreciate it very much!


Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Have you ever wondered how NYC processes its recycling? 


Sunset Park's waterfront is home to the largest commingle recycling facility in the nation.

Just about all of the city's recyclables end up at Sunset Park MRF (Material Recycling Facility)... which services barges, trains and trucks to process as much recyclable material as possible.

Join us for a tour of the Sims MRF and "Zero waste" presentation/discussion.. plus networking with refreshments on a waterfront deck overlooking NYC harbor.


AGENDA

* 6:00 - 6:45pm: Networking with drinks and snacks.

* 6:45 - 8:00pm: Presentation by Eadaoin Quinn, Director of Education at Sims Recycling... followed by a tour of the facility.

* 8:00 - 9:00pm: More networking, food and drinks while viewing the last rays of sunset.

Ms. Quinn's "Zero Waste" discussion is excellent!  Lots of insider info and knowledge on green issues facing the waste management industry.

We toured last year and can't wait to visit again... it's that good!

Throughout the tour you will see how NYC processes waste, manages recycling, and treats different waste streams.

Every New Yorker should tour the Sunset Park MRF.

NOTE: Please wear closed-toe shoes.
results.name: Tour the Largest Commingled Recycling Plant in the USA

results.description:
Technology is driving and changing business at an unprecedented speed. Join our distinguished panel of seasoned technology veterans as they discuss their non-standard foray into the world of technology. We will discuss how individuals with non-traditional backgrounds can take part in the "Technology Gold Rush". Light food and refreshments will be served.

Our Panelists:

Michael Dunner 

Senior Technical Account Manager 

Microsoft Corporation 

Michael has close to 20 years IT experience in the areas of software development, program management, project management, consulting, and service delivery management. He has worked at Microsoft for over 16 years and the majority of his experience has been in the area of cyber security, where he served as a Program Manager in both Window Security and Office Trustworthy Computing and as a Cyber Security Consultant. He has co-authored two best-selling titles on writing secure code and holds degrees in Computer Science and Business Administration.

Anthony Dupree 

CIO and Chief Information Security Officer 

Novitex Enterprise Solutions

Prior to joining Novitex, Anthony served as the Senior Director of Technical Security Standards and Risk Assessment at McGraw-Hill Education, where he oversaw information security programs. He also held executive roles at Elizabeth Arden and Toys R Us, managing global enterprise IT security, network infrastructure and risk and compliance programs.

Anthony has served as an Army Reserve officer for over 25 years achieving the rank of Lieutenant Colonel; received the Bronze star for outstanding achievement while deployed during Operation Iraqi Freedom in 2003. Anthony holds certifications from the Information Systems Audit and Control Association and the International Council of E-Commerce Consultants. He received his Bachelor of Arts degree from the New York Institute of Technology and a Master's degree in Technology from the Stevens Institute of Technology.

Anthony Dupree was recently recognized as a 2016 Silver Winner of the Info Security Products Guide Global Excellence Award for CSO/Security Executive of the Year! More than 50 judges from a broad spectrum of industry voices from around the world participated in these awards, and winners were honored for their excellence in every facet of the industry including products, people behind the successes and best companies.


Tyrone Terrence McKinney

President

BDPA Metro NY[masked] and Binary Touch Inc.

Tyrone has worked as a Senior Technology Consultant for Actavis, AT&T Information Systems, AT&T Corporate Headquarters, Bank of America, CitiGroup/Salomon Smith Barney, Bloomberg LP, Credit Agricole, CBS, CBTS, CS First Boston, Collective Systems, Federal Reserve Bank of NY, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Markit, Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, UBS Inc., New York Genome Center, Xaxis and XL Capital Group. He studied at St. John's University where he successfully completed course work for an undergraduate degree in computer science and he has completed numerous technical courses and seminars over the last twenty years.

Tyrone holds technical certifications from RedHat, Oracle, and Symantec Software. He has been or is a member of AITP, ASNP, International Who's Who of Professionals, Madison Who's Who and USENIX. Tyrone is a Board Member and Technology Chair of 100 Black Men Inc., of New York, meetup group organizer of the Black Technology Professionals and Minority Technology Careers and is also the President of BDPA Metro New York[masked]

Light food and refreshments will be served.

results.description:
Hi WIVR NYC Members!

This month, we'll be bringing together a group of speakers who have all designed experiences in Unity for VR. Whether you've dabbled in the game engine design software or not-- you'll be sure to learn about the trials and tribulations of their experiences, as well as witness the fun part (their end designs!)

Each speaker will present on their VR experience for 15 minutes and then we will move to an hour of demoing and mingling.

This Month's Speakers:

 Kati Nawrocki -- Art Direction and Biz Dev at Computer Lunch


Kati Nawrocki is an illustrator, artist, and gif enthusiast based in New York. Since studying fine arts at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, she has not stopped drawing. She loves to travel (Kati's Big City Tales), going to concerts (musikati) and doing research, all of which informs her children's books and games. She twitters @katinawrocki. She is also the Global Creative Director at The Economist Group.


Kati will be speaking about her game Swing Star VR. SwingStar’s deceptively simple controls use only a button and your line of site to sore, flip, swing, fly, and explore in ways you have never experienced in any other video game.

Zhen Cao -- NYU VR Lab

Zhen is working towards her Masters of Arts and Public Policy at NYU and recently just created a VR experience for NYU's VR Lab.


She will be speaking about Angry Jenga, a prototype mixed reality game that turns a single VR-capable machine into a social hub.

The game allows up to three players at a time to use standard issue smartphones to compete against each other with a fourth player immersed in VR. The game is simple: one player, using an HTC Vive, is represented in VR as a floating clown head and hands. The clown attempst to build and defend a tower of virtual wooden blocks. Their exploits are projected on a large screen behind them, for all in the room to see. The other three players (the “demo team”), stand in assigned positions with their smartphones and attempt to topple the tower being built by aiming and firing circus cannons. The clown is able to deflect the incoming projectiles, using objects in the environment. 

Not only is this a very fun and competitive social game, but it also allows a potentially quite large group of people to share a single VR setup.

Jacqueline Hurwitz -- Producer, Director Part2 Pictures | NYU VR Lab


Jackie is a long-standing member of Part2's Lisa Ling team. She is currently a Producer and Director on CNN's inaugural season of This Is Life, and is a four-season veteran of Our America with Lisa Ling on the Oprah Winfrey Network, where she associate produced episodes on topics ranging from demon exorcisms to senior citizen sex ed. 


She recently created an experience for NYU's VR Lab called The Giftschrank (Poison Room) which she will be discussing.

In Giftschrank (Poison Room), you have to save a masterpiece and solve puzzles from a famous art heist before you are caught by the culprit.

Angelique Ellyn Anderson -- Founder / Creative Director of LIQUE Story Studio, Inc. | NYU VR Lab

Angelique is the Founder & Creative Director of LIQUE Story Studio, Inc., an early stage start-up to develop creative content and children's picture book apps, utilizing Virtual Reality (VR/AR) platforms for mobile devices. She is a multi-disciplined artist with a background in digital publishing, virtual reality, 3D modeling, textures and fabric prints. 

Angelique's career has spanned from working with Time Warner developing interactive web content to working with award-winner, Alex Pineda, Creative Director at APB News Online, Moviefone and FOX. Her work has been nominated twice for a Rockefeller Foundation Grant and awarded a Smithsonian Laureate for interactive VR projects. 

Her VR project is archived at the Smithsonian Institute, National Museum for Women in the Arts. She is included in the CLARA Database of Women Artists. Her work has been published in the Leonardo, the ISEA catalogue, and adorns the covers of Avalon Books -- Thomas Bouregy, NY.

Angelique exhibits at galleries in New York, Wash. D.C., and Paris. Her work is available through Viridian Artists Gallery, New York: <a>http://viridianartists.com.</a>;

She created an experience for NYU's VR Lab called Humpty and Other Goosey Tales. 

Humpty and Other Goosey Tales is a collection of children’s fairy tales for a picture-book app in Virtual Reality / Augmented Reality.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

A special thanks to Janine James, President of The Moderns for hosting our next meetup at her beautiful studio!  And special thanks to Women in VR NY member Sam Witters for making the introduction.

About The Venue:
The Moderns
@ModernsNYC

The Moderns is a certified B Corporation whose creative agency has provided solutions for over two decades in the areas of multidisciplinary design, brand strategy, marketing and communications. They help companies and organizations evolve their brand into cultures by developing integrated solutions that cultivate customer loyalty, generate ideas for sustainable innovations, while remaining holistic in their mission to create campaigns and strategies that benefit the whole community.

Their headquarters are an acclaimed open plan layout, which has been instrumental in bearing creative forums and promoting interaction between scientists, entrepreneurs, ecologists, and designers to produce award winning multidisciplinary work.

Check out their beautiful space!  http://www.themoderns.com/our-space/
results.name: Women in VR -- Unity Experience Builders

This meetup is a place for people to come together and play lighter style, party, and social games.  Think games like Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride, Betrayal at House on the Hill, The Resistance, or Superfight.  The focus is more on having a good time and meeting new people than playing the most competitive games that exist.  

There is a $5 per person cover charge at this venue, but that includes ample table space, and access to a selection of over 160 games.

results.description:
Network with a senior IT Recruiter and technology career coach for JP Morgan and your technology colleagues and learn how to effectively identify IT career goals, while enhancing your ability to fine tune your own. Participate in productive networking conversations designed to provide you with the tools necessary to communicate your value and target the best networking resources for you. 

If you are happy in your current role, and interested in moving up within your company, the is the place to understand how to create a road-map for internal mobility designed to improve visibility and recognition levels. If you are unemployed or unhappily employed, this is a forum to understand how to market yourself for future growth without misconceptions about your qualifications and related experience. 

Share hands-on knowledge from the recruiting and career coaching perspective and hear about challenges head hunters face while working with talented IT resources and the obstacles we overcome every day from the hiring side. Learn how to best represent yourself starting with the resume, your elevator pitch, how you respond to questions, what the best questions are for you to ask and some of the most effective methods to follow up. 

Knowledge is Power. We look forward to sharing!

results.description:
IMAGING ANYWHERE:

This lively presentation explores when to best work with your iPhone, point and shoot, full frame mirrorless, or DSLR camera equipment. You'll learn how to quickly and easily transfer images from your professional camera to your iPhone or tablet for professional image processing. We'll also explore a variety of apps to expand your iPhone to capture and enhance your photographs.

Please note: Katrin works with the Apple iPhone and Sony Cameras but many of the concepts and techniques will work with other smartphones, cameras and computer platforms.

Katrin Eismann

is an internationally respected artist, teacher, and author specializing in creative digital photography. Katrin is the co-author of Photoshop Restoration & Retouching, Photoshop Masking & Compositing, The Creative Digital Darkroom, and Real World Digital Photography. In 2005, Katrin was inducted into the Photoshop Hall of Fame and was recently named a Sony Artist of Imagery. Her images have been featured in numerous books, magazines, group and solo exhibitions. Katrin is the founder and chair of the Masters in Digital Photography department at the School of Visual Arts in New York City.

Join us on Thursday, May 26th, 2016 when the Photoshop Diva, Katrin Eisman, shares her concepts about Creative Digital Photography with us. (This presentation is not a Photoshop or Lightroom workshop.) It is a conceptual presentation of how to pre-vizualize what you're shooting while coming to grips with how Photoshop and/or Lightroom can help you make your visualization a reality. (Think before you shoot!)

It's so much easier to get there when you know where you want to go!

Katrin's presentation isn't a lecture or a workshop, it's an adventure.

DON"T MISS IT, YOU'LL NEVER FORGIVE YOURSELF
results.name: Monthly Meetings - Katrin Eisman (Photoshop Diva) Presents: IMAGING ANYWHERE

Since 2011, our group has expanded to several hundred real estate investors who are constantly learning & earning together in NYC. Come and meet our EPIC Community of Local Real Estate Investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. 

Within our real estate investing community, we help train people with no experience to professionals who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So No license or experience is necessary, and if you are a professional, you are more than welcome to join us and learn how we create successful network of educated real estate investors.

Real Estate can be a very risky business which is why you need to network with other local educated investors, get educated yourself so you can invest in real estate, learn to save money on taxes, and build wealth. The bigger our community is, the more we can network and work together!

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about members that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, and we will also talk about how you can make  upto $10k per referral helping our community grow. 


To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location!If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.

results.description:
Talent show with a twist. 
You don't need to put on a "show" for us. 
We want to experience the real & raw & unique.


Come and share your expressions, passions, stories... the things that make you... YOU. 

Things like: improv melodic gibberish, vulnerable poetry written from amidst a hurricane, free-style rap in Chinese, avant-garde Ukulele songs, or spontaneous stories bringing us to tears.

From the audience or on the stage, it's about inspiration, connection, and discovering a new kind of brave. 

A place with a warm, welcoming vibe, where you are free to be fully alive and we all want to see each other thrive.

We hope this experience is a fun release, and perhaps to find a sense of peace.

Give it a whirl, and see what could be!

https://youtu.be/Kv_V5fiDiBg

All are welcome to participate in the way that feels best to you! Supporting others is also super duper important, so feel free to just soak in the atmosphere from the audience.

If you'd like to share on stage, the sign-up is open mic style. Before the show, just put your name down and then you'll have up to 4 minutes to share.

6:15 - 6:30pm :: pre-stage mingle
6:30 - 7:45pm :: ON stage
8pm and beyond :: post-stage mingle, at the bar or back garden area depending on the weather.

The show is free with an optional $5 suggested donation. The venue, Pete's Candy Store, is not actually a candy store, haha. The bar will be open with drinks and some sandwiches too - please plan to support the venue when joining us, so they let us keep coming back! 

Yay!! See you soon!


Cheers,
Christina + Stef with an F

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full. We are not accepting any more players at this time. Feel free to message me and I can reach out if a spot opens up in the future.


INTRODUCTION:Until just days ago, most members of our party were blissfully unaware of the Keys of Power and their creator, the Aramago. Even those that had any inkling of these topics thought the stories they’d heard to be mere legends. Then one of the Keys of Power was almost literally dropped in their lap. They were suddenly running for their lives guarding Melrick, the courier ferrying that item to a safe place.


Now, Melrick is dead and the party is cast adrift in an alien realm of existence. What’s worse, they’ve been separated from more than half of their number with seemingly no hope to reunite with them. So Theron, Clovis, and Drom cast about for ways to return to their home plane, reunite with their comrades, and most importantly, convey the precious cargo they carry to its rightful place.


However, all is not lost. Potential new allies have stepped forward. Already the elven ranger Thamior has shown his worth by warning the party of an impending ambush and nearly dying in helping to fight it off. And he’s introduced them to two more he knows can be trusted once the four of them reach the tiny village they hope will be a safe haven. They have just begun to relax for a much-needed warm meal when a gypsy strolls into the tavern and engages them directly with a desperate plea for help.


BACKGROUND:"The Keeper of the Keys" is a home-brewed, Dungeons and Dragons campaign. It is a shell that encompasses the numerous, separate adventures the players will enjoy during an epic quest to recover all the Keys of Power.


This game is one of two, biweekly games I am running in the Central Jersey D&D MeetUp group under the banner of “Adventures in Azocar”. It meets on the second and fourth Thursdays of each month. We may also have additional meetings if there’s a fifth Thursday in any given month but mostly, this will probably be kept open for make-up games.


I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game. I know this because each time I've run "The Keeper of the Keys", it's encompassed almost the entirety of the PC's lifespan as adventurers.
results.name: The Keeper of the Keys - An Azocar Adventure

results.description:
>>RSVP Required - Click here to reserve your seat!<<

Join us for another night of presentations and conversation about the intersection of medicine and emerging technologies. This time we're discussing patient data sharing, genomics and new ways of connecting with researchers. RSVP required! 

A big thank you to our supporters, Digitalis Ventures, and our hosts at NYU Langone Medical Center!


6:30 PM - Check-in, Networking and Light Snacks


7:00 PM - Welcoming Remarks by Dr. Larry Chu, Executive Director, Stanford Medicine X

7:10 PM - ePatient Ignite! Presentation by Nisha Pradhan, 2014 Medicine X ePatient Scholar

7:15 PM - Introduction to NY Region Events by Doug Kanter, Medicine X NY Community Organizer

7:20 PM - Keynote Address by Jason Bobe, The Resilience Project, Icahn Institute for Genomics at Mount Sinai

7:40 PM - Panel Discussion on Patient Data Sharing, moderated by Doug Kanter, and featuring panelists:

• Jason Bobe, the Resilience Project

• Madeleine Ball, Co-Founder of Open Humans

• Anna McCollister-Slipp, VitalCrowd

8:25 PM - Closing Remarks by Dr. Larry Chu and Doug Kanter

About our speakers:

Jason Bobe 

The Resilience Project

Jason Bobe is Associate Professor and director of the Sharing Lab at the Icahn Institute for Genomics and Multiscale Biology at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine.

He attempts to produce research efforts that people actually want to join. He works on prototyping collaborative and participatory models of biomedical research and citizen science. With a focus on (a) greatly expanding the rates of participation in organized health research, (b) broadening the types of contributions participants in research are able to make, (c) promoting discovery & engagement through participant-centered research design and “equal access” data sharing practices, (d) the creation of well-consented public resources via the “open consent” framework, (e) building research networks and communities of practice around emerging technologies.  

At Mount Sinai, he is a leader of the Resilience Project, an effort to learn how some people are able to avoid disease despite having certain genetic risk factors.

Since 2007, he has been working to develop a global network of Personal Genome Project (PGP) research studies that collaborate on the development and evaluation personal genomic technologies and practices at increasing scales. The first site was founded at Harvard Medical School in 2005 by George Church, followed by sites at Hospital for Sick Kids / University Toronto (2012), University College London (2013), and the Center for Molecular Medicine in Vienna (2014) – with many more sites under development.

Madeleine Ball, Co-Founder

Open Humans

Madeleine Ball, PhD is co-founder of the Open Humans project and Director of Research at the Personal Genome Project. Her background is in data sharing, genomics, and participatory research. She is dedicated to working together with highly engaged participants to create public data, and to share data directly with new research studies. 

Open Humans is a project that aims to break down data silos in human health and research. Members are invited to connect their data, aggregating it and sharing it with research projects, data analysis tools, and other activities. Researchers recruit Open Humans, enabling participant data access and ongoing data donation. By connecting individuals willing to share existing research data about themselves with researchers interested in using that data, data can be re-used and built upon. 

Anna McCollister-Slipp

VitalCrowd

Anna McCollister-Slipp is the Chief Advocate for Participatory Research at the Scripps Translational Science Institute, where she is charged with bringing the expertise of patients, caregivers and community physicians into the design of health research. In addition, she is co-founder of Galileo Analytics, a Visual Data Exploration and advanced data analytics company focused on democratizing access to and understanding of complex health data.

Anna’s passion for innovation in health data research is rooted in her personal experiences living with type 1 diabetes. As an entrepreneur and advocate, she speaks frequently about the promise of digital health, the imperative for patient data access and the need for improved outcomes measures for chronic disease. Anna serves on a number of government and private committees and boards aimed at promoting innovative ways to better understand, manage and treat complex health conditions, such as diabetes.

Our supporters:


About Stanford Medicine X:

Stanford Medicine X programs aim to connect all stakeholders to innovate healthcare at the intersection of emerging technologies and medicine. 

Medicine X is a catalyst for new ideas about the future of medicine and health care. The initiative explores how emerging technologies will advance the practice of medicine, improve health, empower patients to be active participants in their own care, and more. Learn more about Medicine X by visiting our website: medicinex.stanford.edu 

https://youtu.be/tNi8BIIH-xo

results.description:
This month we'll have members from Apprenda and Google chatting with us. Our very own, Jesse White, will be giving a run-through of Docker for Mac + Windows Beta.

We're very happy to announce that Cisco are an official DockerNYC supporter! We'll be hosting our monthly meetups at Cisco HQ going forward. Huge thanks to DockerNYC member Oleg Ozeriansky­ for making this happen!

Not using Docker Beta yet? Register for early access: beta.docker.com.

Talks will begin at 7pm.

Security

To gain entry you'll need to RSVP with your FULL NAME in order to get past security. We will not be granting late access to those who do not RSVP with their FULL NAME in order to gain entry to the building.

We're looking forward to seeing everyone. 

Thanks,

The DockerNYC Team

Follow our team for updates and more:

Jesse White -- Luisa Morales -- Dusty Mabe

Event Details 
-----------------

Speaker

D. Ian Mortimer  of Apprenda

Talk Summary

Enterprises are hugely interested in using Docker but have wrestled with using it effectively and how to add it to their workflows. The Apprenda Platform as a Service (PaaS) added Docker support in April 2015 to address these concerns.

Apprenda Senior Sales Engineer D. Ian Mortimer will demonstrate how Apprenda’s PaaS supports Docker and demo the workflow for deploying Docker-based applications. Additionally, he will discussApprenda’s plans to support more container features in the future including a high-level overview ofApprenda’s Kubernetes plans.

Speaker Bio:

D. Ian Mortimer is a Senior Sales Engineer for Apprenda, where he has been integral in advising customers on technology, organization, and process changes associated with PaaS adoption. Ian has a career spanning nearly 20 years in the startup, enterprise and innovation world of technology. With in-depth experience in financial services, retail and innovative technology, Ian is a leading advisor to the industry’s top management teams on how to move enterprises forward. 


Speaker

Ray Tsang of Google

Title: My Slow Internet vs. Docker

Talk Summary

Ray lived in a 180-sqft (~18m2) micro-studio near New York. It had no kitchen but it did come with free, but slow Wi-Fi. Ray's a Developer Advocate at Google and he travels a lot, often needs to build Docker images on the airplane, in coffee shops, or in hotels with unpredictable Wi-Fi. Learn how Ray adapted to working with large Docker images over slow Wi-Fi by utilizing Docker Machine in the cloud, and a bunch of tips and tricks! This strategy also saved Ray from numerous demoes - he once demoed Docker containers and Kubernetes by tethering to his colleagues' phone connection.

In this session, you'll learn:

• How to easily setup Docker Machine in the cloud (much better than local VMs!)

• Docker Machine in the cloud

• How to reduce your local bandwidth needs when building an image

• How to use Docker ONBUILD

• Sharing data between local laptop and a remote Docker machine

• Strategy w/ ENTRYPOINT and STDIN/STDOUT

• Working w/ Kubernetes

• Preventing Docker from taking up all the space

Speaker Bio

Ray is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform. Ray had extensive hands on cross-industry enterprise systems integration delivery and management experiences during his time at Accenture, managed full stack application development, DevOps, and ITOps. Ray specialized in middleware, big data, and PaaS products during his time at Red Hat while contributing to open source projects, such as Infinispan. Aside from technology, Ray enjoys traveling and adventures.

Sponsors

Interested in sponsoring? Ping us a message!


The Docker NYC meetup abides by a Code of Conduct. Stay informed: read about it here.
results.name: DockerNYC: Apprenda, Google + Docker Beta

results.description:
MAY 26, 2016 (THURSDAY) 6:30PM

NYC ATHEISTS MONTHLY MEETING

TAKE A LOOK AT THIS VIDEO:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E7cG1y1BDn0 


SUBJECT: STOP POLITICIANS SAYING: "GOD BLESS AMERICA"

A veiled threat to Atheists, Agnostics, Humanists and  Nontheists of all types that America is being reclaimed  from their godless clutch. Perhaps more than any other  phrase, it became the rallying cry of the latest historical resurgence of religiosity in America and remains so today.

From its disturbing roots to its more annoying use as a Christian identity marker,

Learn about the history and the usage of the phase "God Bless America" Our speaker will deconstruct the phase: "God Bless America."

SPEAKER: TIM LAW

For nearly 30 years, Mr. Law has been a citizen-advocate for church-state separation in public institutions, non-profits, corporations and especially public schools, where he has fought numerous battles for strict separation. As an observer of political language, Mr. Law is now focused on deconstructing religious language in politics.


-----------------------------------------------------


NYC Atheists has recently sent a petition (signed by over 125 members) to President Obama and every U.S. Senator and Representative, Governor Cuomo and all New York State and Assembly members and Mayor DeBlasio and all New York City Council members to stop using "G-d Bless America" at the conclusion of their speeches.


-----------------------

LOCATION: SLC Conference Center, 15 West 39th St. (3rd Floor)

COST: $10 Donation covers room rental.

=====================================

results.name: STOP POLITICIANS SAYING: "GOD BLESS AMERICA" /NYCA MEETING/MAY 26 (THUR) 6:30PM

results.description:
TV Runway // Terena Bell


TVRunway finds the clothes from your favorite shows with a single click while you watch online. Just by inserting 3 lines of code, retailers can have access to a new revenue stream, increased engagement and verifiable viewer data.


Convert Media // CEO and Founder, Yoav Naveh

ConvertMedia's proprietary platform and broad range of video formats allows for revenue maximizing holistic management and design of a viewer's entire session that can drastically improve the aesthetics of a publisher's content page vs. the current default patchwork style.

Teleport // Gavrilo Bozovic

Teleport is a young Swiss start-up active in interactive on-line video. They developed a platform which allows distributing scrollable, media-enriched video, through web browsers.

Snakt // COO and Co-Founder, Tristan Snell

Snakt is an invite-only iOS app for video that lets you create "video legos" of 7-second-or-less clips for infinite remixing and compilations.

results.description:
This month, our meetup will be focusing on the relationship between Customer Success and Sales. We'll be bringing in Customer Success and Sales professionals to share with you their insights and experiences.


How does CS and Sales work together? What's the best way to leverage Customer Success during pre-sales and renewals? Are their opportunities to grow from CS to Sales or vice-versa. These questions will be answered and more on Thursday, May 26th. 

Our panelist include: 

Daria D'Italia joined LinkedIn in February 2015 in a sales role after being on the client side for many years as a corporate recruiter. In March 2016, Daria moved from the sales role into a customer success role. She is eager to help her clients achieve the same success she achieved using the platform, and is especially knowledgeable and passionate about Employer Branding. When not immersed in all things talent related, Daria enjoys live music, hanging with friends, and trying not to kill the plants in her apartment.


Sarah Sheikh leads the BetterWorks Customer Success team in the East, and was one of the company's earliest hires. In addition to building the CS function, she has partnered with some of the company's earliest and most strategic clients to help them be successful with BetterWorks and OKRs. Prior to BetterWorks, Sarah worked at Microsoft/Yammer and Cisco Systems. A thought leadership trailblazer, she co-created the CS Meetup Group in New York City and co-founded her alma maters Harry Potter fan club.


Jonathan Kim is a Solutions Engineer with BetterWorks NYC. He has held similar technical selling roles within other enterprise technology companies, most recently as a Data Solutions Architect with Socrata as well as a short stint in Customer Success with Laserfiche. As a Solutions Engineer, Jonathan enjoys sitting at the intersection of sales and product, where he is able to keep one foot in the technical world while the other foot in sales allows him to translate those technical features into business value. When the keyboard leaves Jonathan, he enjoys playing golf and having a cool cold beverage.

The panel will be moderated by Liz Lattanza. Since beginning her sales career many years ago, Liz has grown a passion for positioning herself as a 'professional problem solver' for her clients - working to develop a deep understanding of their business and helping them find the best path for success.  She's transitioned through various industries including social media/communications, recruitment/talent acquisition, and now most recently in a Customer Success role in the exciting realm of goal setting + operational excellence at BetterWorks.  In her free time, Liz loves traveling, going on culinary adventures in NYC and is addicted to any and all shows on HBO.

Stop by the Work-Bench office on Thursday, May 26th, to meet and mingle with your peers in Customer Success. We'll provide drinks and snacks, you bring the conversation!
results.name: Customer Success Meetup

MakerSquare is a school of software engineering with a full-time 3 month immersive program after which 96% of graduates get full-time software engineering roles within 3 months of graduating. We'll provide a dinner and refreshments for you, and you can engage in an open forum with the MakerSquare staff, who can address questions like: 

• Will I learn enough at MakerSquare to have a career as a software engineer?

There are plenty of game industry networking events, bar mixers, and drink nights out there, but we wanted to do something a little different—so instead, we started up the IGDA NYC Coffee and Ice Cream Socials.

Held at an ice cream parlor rather than a bar, our socials are alcohol-free, family-friendly, and open to all ages.

We'll be at Ample Hills Creamery in Gowanus, Brooklyn, with a roomy upstairs space and a great menu of whimsical, handcrafted flavors, including dairy-free vegan options.

Come grab a cone or a cuppa and hang out with fellow game devs!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Join us for this amazing night of fun, food, drinks, conversations and awesome views! We are getting together dozens of fun and friendly people to enjoy NYC at its best! The night will include a leisurely stroll around the Fulton Ferry Pier under the Brooklyn Bridge, A fun history walk over the Brooklyn Bridge and a trip to the outdoor Smorgasburg at The South Street Seaport Historic District featuring food from Cemitas El Tigre, Lonestar Empire, Lumpia Shack, Milk Truck, Pizza Moto, Ramen Burger, Red Hook Lobster Pound, and Schnitz. 

There are also several locations where you can get craft beers and specialty cocktails. Meet us in Manhattan or Brooklyn! This tour is for members and friends of our group, it is not open to tourists.  Members who are new to the city or have been here all their live are welcome.!  

How it works:

1. Meet the group on the Manhattan Side at The Dark Horse Saloon on Murry Street from 6:30-7pm or Meet us in front of the Shake Shack at The Brooklyn Fulton Ferry Landing at 7:30pm.

2. We will socialize, get ice cream, snacks and cocktails.

3. At 8pm the group will leave for a private history tour/walk over the bridge towards Manhattan.

4. When we arrive on the Manhattan side the group will walk a few short blocks to the Historic Section of the South Street Seaport where they have created an outdoor beer/wine/cocktail & food garden.  We will get tables together and enjoy socializing under the stars!

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I expect? 30-40 people looking to do something a little different than going to a nightclub

What is the cost?  $15 includes the history tour and guide fee. 

*** Please bring exact change to the event ***

How long does it last? We will finish the official tour around 9pm then go out for food and drinks.  Stay as long or as little as you would like.

Can I skip the tour and just meet the group at The Seaport?  Yes but that defeats the whole purpose of the night.  The journey & sights are a big highlight.

What if it rains? We will find a location near the Seaport to gather for food and drink.

Emails will be sent before the event explaining exact meeting locations/instructions.
results.name: Brooklyn Bridge Sunset Walk/Seaport Smorgasburg:Food-Drinks-Views-History-Social

results.description:
** MARK YOUR CALENDAR ** 


Join us Thursday 5/26 before you split town for Memorial Day weekend, and share some drinks with fellow creatives and entrepreneurs! Your first drink is FREE with the First Call app (iPhone only for now. You can download First Call before or at the party: click here).

If you've never before been to a Meetup and you're interested in making friends in NYC's startup community, then you should definitely join!

LIMITED SPACE. RSVP TODAY. INVITE FRIENDS.


ABOUT INSIDE STARTUPS
