Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Join us for this amazing night of fun, food, drinks, conversations and awesome views! We are getting together dozens of fun and friendly people to enjoy NYC at its best! The night will include a leisurely stroll around the Fulton Ferry Pier under the Brooklyn Bridge, A fun history walk over the Brooklyn Bridge and a trip to the outdoor Smorgasburg at The South Street Seaport Historic District featuring food from Cemitas El Tigre, Lonestar Empire, Lumpia Shack, Milk Truck, Pizza Moto, Ramen Burger, Red Hook Lobster Pound, and Schnitz. 

There are also several locations where you can get craft beers and specialty cocktails. Meet us in Manhattan or Brooklyn! This tour is for members and friends of our group, it is not open to tourists.  Members who are new to the city or have been here all their live are welcome.!  

How it works:

1. Meet the group on the Manhattan Side at The Dark Horse Saloon on Murry Street from 6:30-7pm or Meet us in front of the Shake Shack at The Brooklyn Fulton Ferry Landing at 7:30pm.

2. We will socialize, get ice cream, snacks and cocktails.

3. At 8pm the group will leave for a private history tour/walk over the bridge towards Manhattan.

4. When we arrive on the Manhattan side the group will walk a few short blocks to the Historic Section of the South Street Seaport where they have created an outdoor beer/wine/cocktail & food garden.  We will get tables together and enjoy socializing under the stars!

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I expect? 30-40 people looking to do something a little different than going to a nightclub

What is the cost?  $15 includes the history tour and guide fee. 

*** Please bring exact change to the event ***

How long does it last? We will finish the official tour around 9pm then go out for food and drinks.  Stay as long or as little as you would like.

Can I skip the tour and just meet the group at The Seaport?  Yes but that defeats the whole purpose of the night.  The journey & sights are a big highlight.

What if it rains? We will find a location near the Seaport to gather for food and drink.

Emails will be sent before the event explaining exact meeting locations/instructions.

This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
This is the first of several tutorials in which I (Jim Savage) will introduce building Bayesian time-series models in Stan. 

In this first session, we'll cover "Modern Statistical Workflow", a process that will help you build error-free, deployable models. As a part of the workflow, we will introduce two basic time-series models: 

- Univariate autoregressive (AR(p))

- Time-varying parameter AR models.

The tutorial will be applied--you will build, estimate, and compare the models. 

Later sessions will cover more sophisticated time-series models, including Vector Autoregressive models, stochastic volatility models, and structural time-series models. 

Attendants should have R, R Studio, and the package `rstan` installed on a laptop before coming along. An intermediate statistics background is required. 

We will go for drinks afterwards. Pizza and soda will be provided.

results.description:
We took a break last month and had a very enjoyable dinner at Jane St. Tavern. Now, back to discussion, and this month the topic will be Intuition.

Intuition, also sometimes called "the sixth sense," can be defined as "the ability to sense or know immediately without reasoning." We all have had hunches, gut feelings, or intuitive insights. The feeling one gets when first hearing about or seeing something or someone, or the first impression when we meet someone new...these are all examples of intuition. These insights swim to the surface of our attention and ask us to do something. Some are big decisions: See the doctor now; marry this man; don't get on that plane. Others are barely perceptible: There's something off about that new guy in accounting—be careful. Intuition is often considered the ability to synthesize and deduce from all of our accumulated unconscious experiences. Therefore, we  have the ability to "know" more than we realize if we use our (other) five senses to "tune in" to our intuition. Those who pay attention can find intuition a useful tool in their lives.

Let's explore these questions:

1. What is your personal definition of intuition?

2. When is it safe to "go with your gut?"  When is it not?

3. In what circumstances have you used intuition to come up with an answer, solution, or action?

4. Is intuition more powerful than logic or analytical thinking?

5. What is the "right" balance between "rational" thought and intuition?

Here's an interesting article on the subject:

https://www.psychologytoday.com/articles/200705/gut-almighty

It's sure to be a great discussion and please be sure to bring your own questions and comments. Looking forward to seeing everyone!
results.name: Dinner and Discussion on "Intuition"

Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
All registrants of this event  should possess or be pursuing and advanced Degree or have a degree from an Ivy League institution. The advanced degree is preferred but not required.

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again.

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: SpeedMeeting for Ivy League/Advanced Degree Singles 30-45

results.description:
This month, NYC Apps is featuring three great startups with three uniquely compelling visions of information delivery to a mobile device. We can't wait for our members to hear and learn from these special guests!


grind is our event host:

Overview:

7:00 pm – Good eats and conversations

7:20 pm – Discussion on the latest in the mobile landscape

7:30 pm – Presentations: theSkimm / Quartz / Hardbound

9:00 pm – NYC Apps after-party

Presenters:

Dheerja Kaur, Head of Product, theSkimm

Dheerja Kaur is Head of Product at theSkimm, one of the fastest-growing startups in New York. They've redefined the morning routine by delivering news and information with a distinctive voice and have built an audience of over 3.5 million daily subscribers. theSkimm recently launched a new product on iOS, Skimm Ahead, that makes it easier to be smarter about the future by integrating directly into your calendar.

Prior to theSkimm, Dheerja was the product lead for the ESPN.com responsive redesign, launched in April 2015. She led a large, cross-functional team to reimagine the entire ESPN web experience. Before that, Dheerja was a Developer and Product Manager for ESPN Mobile and ESPN.com. She built core APIs that power all digital products, worked on some of ESPN's flagship iOS and Android apps, and collaborated with editors to build great content experiences.

Dheerja graduated from Columbia University's engineering school. She was born a sports fan and spends her free time despairing about the Jets and US national soccer team, her only consolation being her numerous fantasy football championships. You'll find her in Brooklyn when she's not backpacking around the world!

Sam Williams, Senior Software Engineer, Quartz

Sam Williams (@stimply) is Quartz's Senior Software Engineer and is obsessed with rethinking journalism, working with data and making cool things at Quartz. He was previously at Macmillan Publishers where he worked on various digital products, primarily focused on higher education learning. He also has an unhealthy obsession with bitcoin and multi-color LED lightbulbs.


Nathan Bashaw, Co-Founder and CEO, Hardbound

Nathan Bashaw is the co-founder and CEO of Hardbound, a new format of visual storytelling that's designed for phones. Before this, he co-created Product Hunt, and General Assembly's Dash, which has taught over 300k people how to code.

This month's apps:

Skimm Ahead: iOS

Quartz: iOS

Hardbound: Beta sign-up

Twitter accounts to follow:

@theSkimm / @qz / @hardbound

NYC Apps social accounts:

@nycapps / #nycapps

Facebook page: NYC Apps

We look forward to seeing you there.

- NYC Apps

results.description:
All registrants of this event  should possess or be pursuing and advanced Degree or have a degree from an Ivy League institution. The advanced degree is preferred but not required.

Does the Tinder Flake Factor make you want to quit every dating app and traditional online dating site??  How many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many matches do you make on OKCupid, Match, Tinder or Bumble that never contact you or respond to your messages?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.Use this event to make romantic matches as well as meet new friends!

Face to face conversations results in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner and fewer people being blown off.

We will collect everyone's cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration.)

PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

• Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive. 

• Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates."

• On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again.

• You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.Remember, this event is about making lasting connections, so make the most of it and talk to everyone!

• We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 8-10 couples/rounds per event.

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
For May we will be reading Mort(e) by Robert Repino. This book looks super interesting so I'm excited to discuss it with you all!

From Goodreads:

After the “war with no name” a cat assassin searches for his lost love in Repino’s strange, moving sci-fi epic that channels both Homeward Bound and A Canticle for Lebowitz.

The “war with no name” has begun, with human extinction as its goal. The instigator of this war is the Colony, a race of intelligent ants who, for thousands of years, have been silently building an army that would forever eradicate the destructive, oppressive humans. Under the Colony's watchful eye, this utopia will be free of the humans' penchant for violence, exploitation and religious superstition. As a final step in the war effort, the Colony uses its strange technology to transform the surface animals into high-functioning two-legged beings who rise up to kill their masters.

Former housecat turned war hero, Mort(e) is famous for taking on the most dangerous missions and fighting the dreaded human bio-weapon EMSAH. But the true motivation behind his recklessness is his ongoing search for a pre-transformation friend—a dog named Sheba. When he receives a mysterious message from the dwindling human resistance claiming Sheba is alive, he begins a journey that will take him from the remaining human strongholds to the heart of the Colony, where he will discover the source of EMSAH and the ultimate fate of all of earth's creatures.
results.name: May Book Club - Mort(e) by Robert Repino

results.description:
I decided to get a head start on our rooftop series. we will be at Rick's Cabaret for this event. This is a Gentleman's Club and we will be using the rooftop only. We were very successful last year with these venues, so we will be doing it again. These special events does require a ticket to get in, so don't wait too long to purchase. We sold out everyone last year and we expect the same for this year. I am being assisted with Jimmy D. on these events, who actually  promotes them for me. Please bring your own cigars here ( you will get one with your ticket) No cigars are sold here. There are waitresses where you can get your additional drinks. This is the info from Jimmy D. for this event:

Thursday May 26th 2016
Time: 7pm-10pm 

Ticket includes:
General admission 
One Sponsored Cocktail: Woodford Reserve 
One Complimentary Cigar: Romeo & Julieta

This is a private event and must be 21+to enter. 

Join us for an intimate get together with cigar and scotch enthusiasts, taking place on a beautiful private rooftop. Escape your everyday worries and just kick back and relax. 

Dress code: Business casual. No shorts/t-shirts please.

Event location:
Rick's Cabaret Rooftop NY
50 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001

Disclaimer: All sales are final. If the event is rescheduled due to weather, you may transfer your ticket to a later event date. Ticket name transfers must be requested 72 hours before the event.

Tickets are $30 but for our group & guests $15. Each person must have a ticket. The discount code is: MrBob & the link is www.RooftopCigars.com (make sure you order tickets for the right event & date)

NOTE: This event may not be for everyone. If you don't feel comfortable just pass this one up. There may be entertainers later that evening to greet you. All girls are fully clothed on the rooftop. Anyone who is interested in going inside the club later that evening, may do so. That is strickly up to you. If you have any questions you can email me or put it on the site and I will answer you.

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.

results.description:
We'll meet on the northeast corner of the LIC Sports Field (46th Rd. and 5th St.) at 7:00pm for our 6 mile loop around LIC and Roosevelt Island.  Please make sure you can run 4 miles comfortably before trying to run this route.  6 miles is no joke!

We usually head to the pub for beverages and/or snacks afterward - Bring some cash if you would like to participate in our post-run social time. 

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 5 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. Please be prompt.

 As always, if you have any comments, ideas or suggestions, please let us know!

results.description:
Love brazilian music? This ensemble is for you!
We'll get to work on classics of bossa-nova, understand the rhythm patterns and learn the finger style technique to master comping and the nuances of brazilian clave.
You'll get familiar with 7th, 9th, 13th, diminish chords.
Nylon string guitar is recommended for this class but you won't get turned away if you bring a steel string guitar.
You must be familiar with open chords and comfortable playing songs and switching chords in time. Barre chord knowledge is a plus but nor required for this group.

We will prepare a nice set of classics to perform on August 28th at Arlene's Grocery.

Setlist will include:

The Girl From Ipanema

How Insensitive

Desde Que O Samba é Sampa

Corcovado

Manhã de Carnaval

Obrigada!

Whether or not you already know how to play cribbage, come join us for a fun evening (If you do not know how to play, we shall teach you)!

According to the written rules, cribbage is a two- three- or four-handed game, but can also be played as a six- eight- or nine-handed game.  


Come, and let us have a lot of fun together!

results.description:
Thank you for your interest in The Salon.  Our first event is being hosted by "yours truly" on 3/24.  The Salon concept has really caught on and it is growing more rapidly than we could've anticipated or hoped.  With that in mind, we are already planning our calendar for the second quarter.  Topics include:

* Sustainability in finance: how to build and grow a "new model for banking


* Tiles for Peace - come meet the founder of this amazing movement.  She is bringing the tiles back from oblivion.  You will want to hear this story and perhaps join this effort.

* Blockchain: Myth and Reality of this important new technology

* What do you want to propose?

The real reason for this note is item #4 above.  Since you joined this particular Salon (i.e., the best one), please don't hesitate to take some ownership of the agenda.  What would YOU - as a fellow Salonist - like to see our Salon discuss?

Lastly, for those coming (or even for those that aren't) to the 3/24 event, I would like to organize food and drinks.  If you are willing to help out, please let me know by e-mailing me at:  [masked]

- Thomas

CSiR

(Chief Salonist in Residence)

This past Sunday I learned of a new Himalayan restaurant, actually a Manhattan location of a small Queens eatery that I like: Dhaulagiri Kitchen. The menu is principally Nepali. I had a bite for lunch, and on the spot I made a dinner reservation for our group. Here's a brief overview of the national cuisine:


Introduction to Nepalese food


Yes, some say Nepalese and some say Nepali. For our purposes, figure on food that's spicy and meat-heavy, and that occasionally may contain offal.


As always, we'll eat family-style and split the bill evenly (adding an extra $1 each to help cover the cost of maintaining our group on Meetup). Please bring cash, small bills if you have them. Drinks will go on a separate check and must be paid for individually by those who have ordered them. Expect a total cost, including tax and tip, of $25-$30.


RSVP etiquette: We often have a waitlist of people wanting to join us. Please RSVP responsibly. If you must cancel, please do so at least 24 hours before the scheduled time. If you have an emergency the day of, please change your RSVP and also send the organizer an email through the Meetup site.

Special note: In fairness to all, World Food Lovers (other than organizers) may attend only this dinner or the dim sum outing at Joy Luck, on Saturday, but not both. 

We're looking forward to dining with you!

results.description:
Confirmed Panelists: Nick Grossman (Union Square Ventures), Brent Baisley (WorkMarket), Brian Watson (VSCO), Anjali Kumar (Warby Parker), and Jukay Hsu (C4Q)

We invite you to join C4Q and Union Square Ventures (USV) to spend an evening exploring the tech and jobs landscape in NYC. The conversation will focus on industry opportunities, inclusion and diversity across the sector, and how NYC tech can become a leader in representing all communities. The second largest sector in NYC, the tech industry generates 541,000 jobs and 124.7 billion dollars in annual output.

USV is currently hiring for a new analyst, and their NYC portfolio companies are always hiring for engineers, designers, marketers, community managers, and more. This is a rare opportunity to ask directly about working at USV, what it’s like to be a VC, and what it’s like to work at some of the leading tech companies. The panel will be moderated by C4Q founder Jukay Hsu and include USV investors and representatives across their portfolio companies.

About Union Square Ventures: Union Square Ventures is a NYC-based venture capital firm that has invested in over 80 web and mobile companies over the past decade. It has provided early funding to iconic NYC companies such as Kickstarter, Etsy, Foursquare, Tumblr, Stack Overflow -- and other companies such as Twitter. USV's partner Fred Wilson writes a popular blog on the tech industry.

About C4Q: C4Q increases economic opportunity through technology and transforms the world's most diverse community into a leading hub for innovation and entrepreneurship.
results.how_to_find_us: We are inside the Falchi building (on the ground floor in the back).
results.name: Union Square Ventures + C4Q Panel Discussion: NYC Tech + Inclusion

In this session we'll be discussing how to do intensive reconstruction for beauty and product work. (Like how to fix a detailed shot of an out-of-focus face through compositing, or how to "invent" parts of products when the client has not photographed the product in question.)

We will also revisit the "test" images distributed at our last session, so if you've worked on any of the files and would like to get some feedback, bring them in on a drive and we'll check them out together.


We will have one station hooked up to a projector for presenting materials. I encourage you all to bring your images, before & afters, layered files, etc., so that we may review and critique them. The room we will be using seats 18, with electrical outlets for those of you who would like to bring your own laptops. I'd like to review members' portfolio websites as well, so make sure your sites are up-to-date. If you have business cards, or a physical portfolio book, please bring those too.

If anyone has something in particular they are interested in discussing, please send me an email about it and I'll do my best to prep for it! Bring your questions, people!

Please be aware when you RSVP that if you say you will be in attendance, and then do NOT show up– WITHOUT updating your RSVP to reflect your inability to attend– you will be fined $10. If you are a no-show (meaning you say you'll attend and don't show up without changing your RSVP) three times, you will be dismissed from the group.

There is no penalty for changing your RSVP (BEFORE the scheduled meetup). So if you say you'll come, and then you can't make it, simply change your RSVP to "no"; no harm done. Please just be respectful with your participation (or lack thereof). Thanks!

results.description:
Please RSVP Here

Hi TAPers!  We're excited to feature an event by some our favorite presenters from the best of TAP, including Greg Lindsey, moderator of Coworking and the Future of Architecture and Jeff Ferzoco who spoke at Data Driven Design 1.0! Hope you will join us in supporting them!


EVENT DESCRIPTION
The next Urban Salon will deal with questions surrounding how the smartphone is changing urban life.  We will explore how apps like Tinder, Yelp, Google Maps, Uber etc. are affecting the way we live in the city and mediating these relationships. 

For example, take the reliance on apps (Google Maps/Apple Maps/Waze) to navigate the city. How is this reliance affecting the mental geo/spatial maps of the urban citizenry? Is this a material difference? Does it matter?

In a world in which you can meet your future partner, call a taxi to their house and order dinner without looking up from your phone- what is the role of public life?

Free beer, courtesy of sponsor WeWork.


SPEAKERS
Greg Lindsay is a contributing writer for Fast Company, author of the forthcoming book Engineering Serendipity, and co-author of Aerotropolis: The Way We’ll Live Next. He is also a senior fellow of the New Cities Foundation — where he leads the Connected Mobility Initiative— a non-resident senior fellow of The Atlantic Council’s Strategic Foresight Initiative, a visiting scholar at New York University’s Rudin Center for Transportation Policy & Management, and a senior fellow of the World Policy Institute. Greg is a two-time Jeopardy!champion (and the only human to go undefeatedagainst IBM’s Watson). @Greg_Lindsay

Jeff Ferzoco is the NYC Business Development Manager for CartoDB, a mapping and location intelligence company He is a technologist and designer with a specialty in visualizing cities and data – and the experiences that come with those visualizations. His past work includes Citibike, NYU Rudin, Union Square Market and he developed outgoingnyc.com, a mapped NYC history of LGBT nightlife. 
@zingbot

Katrina Johnston-Zimmerman is an urban anthropologist with City ID in New York City specializing in research and analysis of behavior in public space. She is always looking for ways to improve the human experience in cities through Right to the City concepts in combination with our physical and mental needs as a species. @think_katrina

Drew Austin writes about cities, culture, and technology on his blog, Kneeling Bus. He currently works on Uber's operations and logistics team and has previously worked at the Port Authority of NY & NJ and the Chicago Transit Authority.


Don't forget to Please RSVP Here!

See you there!
The TAP Team
results.name: Urban Salon: The Mediated City

results.description:
The opening session of Brooklyn Unconventional Figure Drawing focuses on the male body. Although the male form reigned supreme in classical art, it has been resigned to the rare minority in contemporary figure drawing circles, rarely seen and accompanied by taboos or restrictions on how a male form in art should appear. 

Tonight's drawing session will seek to overcome those restrictions by featuring a male model -- young, tall, and lean -- who will strike poses that accentuate the uniquely male, offering figure artists a chance to practice the underemphasized of the human male form and its possibilities.

Cost: $20 per person, pay in cash at the door


Venue: 382 Hamilton Avenue (across Hamilton Avenue, a short walk from the Smith - 9 Sts. F/G subway station).
results.name: Draw or Paint from a Male Model

It's time for the May session of NightShul!

NightShul is for everyone in Brooklyn’s progressive Jewish Community (nightshul.org for more information and to sign up). You don’t have to belong to a synagogue. You don’t have to believe any specific thing, pray in any particular way, or profess any particular political persuasion. It’s for young adults, seniors and everybody in between, in every generational cohort. It’s a Jewish learning community, but you don’t have to be Jewish to love learning. 

We welcome those who are curious and open-minded. We especially welcome people whose significant other is Jewish and who want to know more of what it’s about. Come be part of this growing community, make friends, learn and have fun. Each evening begins with a wine and cheese hour at 7:00pm, and the learning begins at 8:00pm. Located at the East Midwood Jewish Center, 1625 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11230.

Meetup will continue weekly on Thursday evenings through May 26.

results.description:
Have you ever been to Brooklyn Bridge Park? It's the best new thing in New York City! Join us for a Brooklyn Bridge Park Tour and Nighttime Picnic!

Some people say that New York City's "best new thing" -- in terms of grand public projects that physically enhance the city, typically a public park -- is the new Highline Park. I happen to love the Highline, and have financially supported it. But as amazing as the Highline is, I know something even better: the new Brooklyn Bridge Park.

85 acres in total and spanning the Brooklyn East River waterfront from Manhattan Bridge to Brooklyn Bridge to the entire length of the Brooklyn Heights Promenade (underneath the promenade, directly on the East River), this exquisite new park has won awards for its stunning landscape design. Moreover, and most of all, the views of Manhattan and the East River are beautiful, breathtaking, and unmatchable. And in the midst of it all, there are many wonderful amenities: Jane's Carousel -- built in what looks like a massive glass jewel box; bars and eateries; pools and pop-up pools; a marina; sports and soccer fields built out on piers; extensive free music and movie programming; and much more. But most of all, when you are standing and sitting at night, on the magnificent new esplanade by the East River, with the dramatically beautiful backdrop of lower Manhattan, you'll be transported in a way that nothing else in New York can match.

Plus, there's a fascinating and fun foot bridge that is "bouncy" and "zig-zagging." Built with mountain bridge technology, the new Squibb Park Bridge connects the Brooklyn Heights Promenade to Brooklyn Bridge Park. This foot bridge is one-of-a-kind in New York City, and offers additional exquisite views of the East River and Manhattan.

About Brooklyn Bridge Park and its 30-Year History (from The Sixth Borough - Redefining Brooklyn's Waterfront)

It all started in 1984, when the non-for–profit organization Friends of the Fulton Ferry Landing, which later became the Brooklyn Bridge Park Coalition and finally the Brooklyn Bridge Park Conservancy, was created to prevent the sale of the piers for commercial use. The idea of a park stretching along Brooklyn Heights’ post-industrial waterfront was born.

This community group subsequently sprouted a specialized off-shoot in 1998, the Downtown Brooklyn Waterfront Local Development Corporation, to lead the public planning process for this future waterfront park. It would take two decades before this dream could become reality. Over the next 15 years, a wide variety of actors would be part of the planning process, including “the city administration, the Port Authority, community boards, elected officials, recreational groups, transportation agencies, city wide civic organizations, local business associations, and residents”.

Inauguration of the park’s development was ratified on 2 May 2002. New York State Governor George Pataki and New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg signed a first Memorandum of Understanding (“MOU”), whereby they “agreed to bring the vision of a sustainable public park to fruition in a cooperative manner as set forth [by legal requirements and conditions as outlined] in the Memorandum”.

Between 2004 and 2008, teams of acclaimed architects and landscape architects, lighting designers, acoustical engineers, marine and structural engineers, environmental consultants, irrigation consultants, soil scientists, storm water specialists, and construction companies worked hand-in-hand, led by Michael Van Valkenburgh Associates, for the NY State Urban Development Corp., the Empire State Development Corp., and the BBP Development Corp. to create a general project plan. The plan was proposed and adopted in 2005, and subsequently modified in 2006 and 2010.

All six piers have specific uses and their designs are tailored accordingly. Pier 1, which is 9.5 acres large, offers amenities targeting all age groups. It offers a combination of spaces for recreational, leisurely and cultural use: a playground for children, two lawns, running and biking paths, a promenade with various seating options offering breathtaking views of Manhattan’s skyline, and large open-air spaces to host public events on the two lawns, such as outdoor movie screenings during summer months. This first section of the park opened in March 2010.

A small pedestrian bridge, the Squibb Park Bridge, designed by acclaimed structural engineer Ted Zoli of HNTB, connects Pier 1 and Brooklyn Heights. Proposed in 2009, the bridge was built over a period of two years and opened in 2012. It serves as a pedestrian walkway connecting the lower-lying park area with the higher-lying community of Brooklyn Heights; in itself, it is a beautiful, suspended message of sustainability in its purpose, design, and use of industrial and natural materials.

Where to Meet:

We will meet right on the corner of York Street & Jay Street, directly above the F Train's York Street stop. Take the F Train to York Street, then exit towards the front of the train. Then continue out, in the same direction, towards the front of the station. There is only one exit at the front of the station, and it leads directly to the corner of York Street & Jay Street. I will be holding a "MEETUP" sign on the corner, and you will see a crowd of people. Please arrive between 7:00pm and 7:15pm. Plan to be there before 7:00pm in case the trains are late, just so you don't miss us.

What to Bring: (Food and Water)

This is both a tour and a picnic. Bring food and water for yourself to eat and drink. If you'd like to bring food to share with others, you may, but there is no need to. Any food you bring must be vegan, even if you yourself are not 100% vegan. (This is an event of the NYC Vegans Meetup, and that is part of what we do -- eat vegan food together.) Also, any sharing of food is at your own discretion. Be aware that not everyone may have the same diet as you. We'll be stopping and eating at more than one spot, and my suggestion is to bring a good quantity of food and water for yourself -- perhaps one-and-a-half times your normal dinner size.

I have been having such wonderful nights at Brooklyn Bridge Park. Both the park, and the river views, are magnificent sights to behold, especially at night. I hope you can join us for this beautiful park tour and nighttime picnic by the water.

David
results.how_to_find_us: Take the F Train to York Street. Meet the group above ground, near the subway entrance, at the corner of York St. & Jay St. I will be holding a "MEETUP" sign, and you'll see a crowd on the corner.
results.name: Brooklyn Bridge Park Tour and Night Picnic

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

results.description:
Night Vale is a small town where ghosts, angels, aliens, and government conspiracies are all commonplace. It is here that the lives of two women will converge in mystery. 

// Book   
 Welcome to Night Vale, Joseph Fink and Jeffrey Cranor
From the creators of the wildly popular Welcome to Night Vale podcast comes an imaginative mystery. Located in a nameless desert somewhere in the great American Southwest, Night Vale is a small town where ghosts, angels, aliens, and government conspiracies are all commonplace parts of everyday life. It is here and the lives of two women, with two mysteries, will converge. 
Ninteen-year-old Night Vale pawn shop owner Jackie Fierro is given a paper marked "KING CITY" by a mysterious man in a tan jacket holding a deer skin suitcase. Night Vale PTA treasurer Diane Crayton's son, John, is moody and also a shapeshifter. Diane's search to reconnect with her son and Jackie's search for her former routine life collide as they find themselves coming back to two words: "KING CITY." It is King City that holds the key to both of their mysteries, and their futures... if they can ever find it. 

If you like this book, check out the podcast here. 

// Location
The Kitchen Sink, 88 2nd Avenue 
A new diner-esque bar with good eats and cheap drinks. Let's gather up and people watch. Menu available here. 

// Dues 

This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway!

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
3D Thursday 5/26:  Designing Large with Laura Taalman (mathgrrl) 

Calling all designers, expert and novice! Help us design insanely tall 3D models to print for NYC Maker Faire with an Ultimaker Z-Unlimited. With this crazy wall-mounted 3D printer we can print models that are nearly SIX FEET TALL. Whether you design with Rhino, OpenSCAD, ZBrush, or even Tinkercad, come design crazy models with us!

---

3D Thursdays!

So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting!

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.
results.name: Designing Large

results.description:
Study Hall presents "A Tennis Background," a sports-themed non-fiction reading series hosted by Ian Frisch. Featuring: NWU member David Hill, Mary Pilon, Brett Forrest, and Greg Hanlon. 

Learn more at https://www.facebook.com/events/618753881613219/

David Hill's writing has been featured in GQ and The New Yorker. He was also a regular contributor to Grantland. His 2011 column in McSweeney's, "Fading the Vig," which detailed his personal history with gambling, was selected for Slate's and Longread's best-of-the-year lists. (www.davidhillonline.com)


Mary Pilon is an award-winning reporter and author of the New York Times bestselling book "The Monopolists." Her work has appeared in The New York Times, where she previously worked as a sports reporter, as well as The New Yorker, Esquire, Bloomberg Businessweek, The Wall Street Journal, and more. (www.marypilon.com)

Brett Forrest is a Senior Writer for ESPN The Magazine and author of "The Big Fix," an investigation into the FIFA scandal and match-fixing in professional soccer. His writing has also appeared in The Atlantic, Vanity Fair, and Playboy, among others. (www.brettforrest.com)

Greg Hanlon is a 2014 Livingston Award finalist, whose sports reporting has been anothologized in the Best American Sports Writing. Currently a crime editor at PEOPLE, his writing has also appeared in SportsOnEarth, SB Nation, and Sports Illustrated. (@greghanlon)

***
A note from Ian Frisch about the reading series: 

While reporting for his famed 2006 essay on tennis, "Federer as Relgious Experience," David Foster Wallace commented to Roger Federer's coach, "I am not a journalist—I'm more like a novelist with a tennis background." 

This reading series aims to celebrate writers who find beauty, complexity, triumph, and failure in the world of sports.
results.name: NWU Member Event: Sportswriting Showcase Presented by Study Hall

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
This is a paid meeting and it is online. You are not registered until you sign up and pay. $19.95 To register, please go to: 

http://www.vickielewis.com/photography-workshops/what_is_aperture/

This meeting is online. You will be emailed the information after you sign up.

Now you can understand what the most important settings on your camera mean in just one online class.

The three most important settings on your camera are f/stop, shutter speed and ISO. In this class, you'll learn, in very very simple terms, how your camera works, what each of these settings mean and how they impact your photographs.

After this class, you will feel more comfortable shooting in Shutter Priority or Aperture Priority. You'll have the 'basics' down to understand how to shoot on manual.

To sign up, go to: http://www.vickielewis.com/photography-workshops/what_is_aperture/ 

"Vickie is a sensational teacher, as well as photographer. I bought a camera, but only knew how to use it on automatic. She has given me a great start towards learning about manual. I would absolutely take another class with her. Carolyn"

“Great and informative”

“Thank you Vickie for organizing todays class.  It was great and informative. I really enjoyed it and look forward for the next one!! ” –participant

You will learn:

•  What is an f/stop or aperture?

• What is shutter speed? 

What is ISO? 

What does depth of field mean? 

This class is suitable for beginners as well as those who have been shooting for awhile but want to develop a deeper understanding of how their camera works.

It's been a while since we last said 'hello'. We hope you've been well, personally and professionally.

At long last, we're announcing Cofound Harlem's first ever Demo Day - which we're calling the #UptownTechSummit.

A year ago we set out to prove that Harlem can indeed be transformed into a tech hub. After putting the word out about our program, we chose a few great teams and worked with them nonstop for nine months on helping take their companies to the next level.

The result? Come see for yourself! Demo Day is next week, Thursday May 26th, from 7-10PM at MIST.

JH + the Uptown Tech Crew

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

results.description:
Founded in 1986 by Rick Doblin, the Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS), is a research and educational non-profit organization that develops medical, legal, and cultural contexts for people to benefit from the careful uses of psychedelics and marijuana. For the past 30 years, MAPS has been at the cutting edge of research and advocacy contributing toward the legalization of psychedelic-assisted therapy.

This talk will discuss the history of MDMA-assisted psychotherapy, the results of MAPS Phase 2 MDMA-assisted psychotherapy studies, the approaching End of Phase 2 Meeting with the FDA, the resources and planning needed for Phase 3 Clinical Trials, the current status of medical marijuana drug development research in the United States, and psychedelic harm reduction and psychedelic clinics as methods of preparing for a post-prohibition world.


Tickets:
$20 in advance
$25 at the door

results.description:
Thus spake Wikipedia: 

The Purple Cloud is a "last man" novel by the British writer M. P. Shiel. It was published in 1901. H.G. Wells lauded The Purple Cloud as "brilliant" and H. P. Lovecraft later praised the novel as exemplary weird fiction, "delivered with a skill and artistry falling little short of actual majesty." The novel formed the basis for the 1959 American film The World, the Flesh and the Devil.

Plus, it's on Project Gutenberg so YAY FREE
results.name: May's Post-Apocalyptic Book Discussion: M. P. Shiel's The Purple Cloud

results.description:
Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.
results.how_to_find_us: Typically look for us on the second floor or the presence of paper!
results.name: AWOL - After Work Origami Lovers

results.description:
Our teacher for this class Michael Hamburg is a docent at the Museum of Natural History and works directly under Neil deGrasse Tyson! Join us for an exploration in Space,Time, and Wonder at a beautiful coworking studio in Gowanus Brooklyn. Free beer included during the presentation! RSVP here: http://bit.ly/1NyxFNB

Come on a unique journey across the cosmos. We’ll begin at the beginning almost 14 billion years ago when the Universe was smaller than an atom and continue on to the present, all the while exploring its many extraordinary features. We will then look towards the future and speculate where we are all going. This voyage is perfect for anyone who has ever wondered what the universe actually is, where it came from, and where it is headed. Prior knowledge or any technical expertise in math or science is not required. Just bring your questions and sense of wonder. Part 1 will take us through the Solar System where we will visit the major and minor planets, their moons, and many of the other awesome bodies that circle the Sun. The format of this voyage will be a PowerPoint presentation followed by time for a host of questions from

RSVP: http://bit.ly/1NyxFNB
results.name: Across the Universe: Travels in Space, Time, and Wonder

Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leaders - Joanne & LD)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 7:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 8:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

Fine it's a meetup. Grab your dinner and meet us at the park!

Movies Under the Stars: Wall-E

Thursday, May 26, 2016


8:00 p.m.–10:00 p.m.


Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

What if mankind had to leave Earth and somebody forgot to turn the last robot off? The year is 2700 and WALL-E is a robot still spending every day doing what he was made for. Soon he is visited by a sleek robot named EVE whom he chases across the galaxy with a pet cockroach and a heroic team of malfunctioning misfit robots. Rated G.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 8:00 p.m. to get your spot. Feel free to bring a blanket to sit on; there will be a limited supply of chairs available. Bottled water is OK, but no glass. Reservations are not taken; space is available on a first-come, first-served basis. All are welcome!

results.description:
Would you like to learn about the Chakras in a small and intimate group from your own home?  Join our Skype Class.


Essential Oils and the Charkas!
  Learn about the Chakra System and how Essential Oils can clear, balance, and align your Chakras. You will also learn about the many uses of Essential Oils for well being and health. We will have meditations and exercises to get you in touch with your Chakra System. Receive some Essential Oil recipes to enhance the quality of your life and support your environment. Pamper yourself, relax, and rejuvenate in this class.

Essential Oils are natural aromatic compounds found in the seeds, bark, stems, roots, flowers, and other parts of plants. They have been used throughout history in many cultures for their medicinal and therapeutic benefits. Essential Oils are natural, safe and effective.


If you have ANY interest in natural health, learn how essential oils have assisted the mind and the body work more efficiently!

There will be a drawing for a 5ml bottle of Essential Oil! Chance to win a 1/2 hour skype Chakra Reading.


 You must RSVP by 5pm Thursday and please email me at <a>debra@psychicpremonition</a> or call  to receive instructions on how to connect to the conference.  Space is limited

results.description:
* This is an online only event. Job Seeker Apply, and they'll be contacted by Recruiters if selected *

Job Seeker Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdc

Recruiter Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdr

No long lines, No handshakes, until you're drafted!

AnalyticsWeek's Hire51 is bringing world's largest data analytics hiring drive to town. By last day of every month topdata and analytics talent applicant apply to Data Analytics Talent Drive to help us bring top data opportunities to topdata professionals.

Here's the process:

When: Each month talent run starts with first day of the month. (Data Analytics Hiring Drive resume collection stops last day of the previous month)

Where: In your own preferred city.

Process:

> For Job Seeker:

1. Applicant apply as Job Seeker at: http://math.im/dtdc

2. Anonymized candidates chosen by recruiters will be contacted via email in 3 weeks

3. Upon interview, successful drafted candidate is celebrated in #DataTalentDraft communityIf you're DRAFTED(interviewed and hired), we have some awesome swags for you.

> For Recruiter:

1. Recruiters signup using the form at: http://math.im/dtdr

2. We will share anonymized candidate info and give a week to pick shortlisted candidates

3. Once recruiter shortlist winning profile, we will ask the candidate and send introduction

Here are some things to know about Data Analytics Hiring Drive:

• It is a continuously rolling event on monthly basis

• Candidates will be contacted once their profile is shortlisted by a recruiter

• The candidate profile is kept in database for 3 months

• Candidate with 3 months and older profile are requested to refresh the profile to activate it back again

• Hire51's Data Talent Draft works tirelessly to connect top talent with top recruiting companies

• We are designing an AI bot to scan your profile and go on a hunt to find the right job that suits your profile

• Every passing day we are getting smarter and connecting more profiles to right jobs

• You don't need to go anywhere to participate, just apply on the link given above & below and complete the process so our engine will start working to find right opportunity for you.

In case you missed the links above:

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Job-Seeker Signup @ http://math.im/dtdc

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Recruiter Signup @ http://math.im/dtdr

</a>

<a href="http://math.im/dtdr">

<a href="https://talentdraft.eventbrite.com/?access=dtd"></a>

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Sc3FXzIXg4

Learn and build with the hard parts of JavaScript through intuitive lectures and pair-programming


This week for Javascript - The Hard Parts we cover Callbacks and Higher Order Functions This includes how to handle or recreate the functions:

• map • reduce • forEach This is a concept that 80% of JavaScript engineers do not understand but are at the core of every single successful application

This is possible because we'll understand the essence of these tough concepts and then switch into pair-programming through the challenges to cement the concepts

The evening session is comprised of: 

10pm: Tune in to live stream at 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Sc3FXzIXg4

<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FLZmQCDQ1Ac"></a> 10pm-10:15pm: Once you’re viewing the stream page, check the comments section for a link on how to sign in (if you want to pair program)


10:15pm-10:30pm: Lecture beings, check your inbox for pair programming instructions

10:15pm-11:30pm: Lecture + pair programming

Price: Always free

EVENT TYPE: Travel

DESCRIPTION:

The Finger Lakes are a group of eleven long, narrow, roughly north-south lakes in a region called the finger lakes region in Central New York in the United States. This region is defined as a bioregion. They are a popular tourist destination.

The lakes' shapes reminded early map-makers of human fingers, and the name stuck. Cayuga (435 feet, 133 m) and Seneca (618 feet, 188 m) are among the deepest in the United States, with their bottoms well below sea level. The two longest are close to 40 miles long (64 km) from end to end, and never more than 3.5 miles (5.6 km) wide. Cayuga (38.1 miles) is the longest, and Seneca 66.9 square miles (173 km2) the largest in total area.

==========IMPORTANT NOTE==========

THIS EVENT IS VERY SELECTIVE. This is an Multipart, Multiday Travel Event. There will be some hikes and you need to be somewhat physically fit. If you are serious about this trip, Please RSVP and I will contact you.

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

results.description:
-NEW MEMBER WELCOME-

（※This event is for those who want to study Japanese and who want to teach Japanese.  NOT for Japanese who want to study English）

Come seize the day with us over a cup of coffee, a danish, and Japanese conversation at our early morning events!

These casual gatherings are open for all levels of Japanese. We'll chat about a wide range of topics, from talking about daily life, to comparing our different cultures, and sharing tips we've learned while studying foreign languages.

We look forward to meeting you soon!
