results.description:
Hello Fam

This week, we have Kanyi Maqubela of Collaborative Fund coming by to share his journey!

He was born in Soweto, a township outside of Johannesburg, South Africa, during apartheid. He grew up in New England, where he attended Phillips Academy. Afterwards, he did his undergraduate in Philosophy at Stanford University. It was there that he also studied all sorts of things, most notably computer science, chemistry, physics, and mathematics.

After Stanford, he taught elementary and middle school math and science. Working on Barack Obama's 2008 election campaign is, to date, the most meaningful and difficult work he's ever done. He also really enjoyed being on the teaching team for Design Your Life, a class for undergraduates out of the Stanford Design Program. Early in his career, he served on the initial team at Doostang, an online career community which was acquired by Universum Global. He was also part of the team at One Block Off The Grid, an internet-based solar sales business which was spun out of the incubator Virgance. 1BOG was acquired by Pure Energies Group (now $NRG). Among the random work he's done, he's consulted with a South African private equity firm, a small-car company, the designers behind the mouse and a magazine for people who give a damn. 

Currently he is a partner at Collaborative Fund, a seed fund that is trying to make the world better, one investment at a time. 

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

Future events: 

** Office hours with Rubicon VC - By appointment only**

6/3 - Rodney Gibson (Oscar) 

6/10 - Mary Liu (BDMI)

6/17 - Seth Melnick (Lyft)

results.description:
COURSE INFORMATION:

Title:  Before I Read and Write

Age Suggestion: 2 1/2 through 5

Activities/Philosophy:  We will start each class with circle time, during which books, songs, finger plays, etc. will be incorporated to help foster a love of language in our children.

Many of the beginning Montessori language lessons involve matching.  Each week, new and more abstract matching exercises will be introduced.  We will begin by matching object-to-object, then object-to-picture, then picture-to-picture, and so on.  Eventually, the goal is to match letter symbols to spoken sounds!!  Of course, there are many steps in between; there may be many weeks spent at this stage; and each child is at his/her own developmental readiness level, but this is where it begin.

If your child has passed this stage, but you're interested in what to do next, please let me know.  The language curriculum may be the most individualized of all the areas of study once this stage is achieved.  I will work with your child wherever(s)he is. 

Adult Learning:  Many Montessori "secrets" are exposed in Fun Fingers, but there's always more to learn!  Probably the most basic, yet practical strategy you will learn is the three-period lesson.  It's a way to introduce new information, as well as a way of life!

REGISTRATION  INFORMATION:

You need to register with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department online (or in person at Liberty School) at the following link: 

<a>http://register.community</a>pass.net/Englewood

For help navigating the site, please read the following:


You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of."  After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Browse Activities" button. Scroll down to "2016 Spring Programs & Football."  Click the yellow "Continue" button and follow the remaining prompts.  You will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) 

If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at <a>201–87 1–6551</a> or email [masked].

PAYMENT INFORMATION:

You will pay the fee as part of the registration process.  It is nominal, but regular attendance is highly recommended.  (There is no refund for missed sessions.)

Join New York Adventure Club as we take a private, behind-the-scenes tour of Jeffrey’s Hook lighthouse; erected in 1880 and moved to its current site in 1921, this lighthouse has become widely known as the children’s literary landmark “The Little Red Lighthouse.”

Led by an Urban Park Ranger, our experience will begin with a discussion around the history of the Little Red Lighthouse, tour around Fort Washington Park, and finally special access inside the lighthouse.

After the tour, we’ll head to a local eatery for some food and drinks!

results.description:
SNAKE IN A BOX ILLUSION

Imagine a person walking down a busy NYC Street with a box of live snakes…or is it? We took a cooler, painted it black and stenciled “LIVE SNAKES” on the outside, inside the box we attached a rubber snake to a piece of clear fishing line so it “raises up” when you open the lid. We catch people reacting in fear, then show them there is nothing to be afraid of by opening the lid (then we get a SECOND reaction) and get their expressions and reactions on camera. This stunt proves that people make snap judgments based on false perceptions which causes irrational fear. It is SO much fun!!! So if you want to help FILM or BE on camera or a combination of both then come meet us! Afterwards we will grab a slice of pizza and watch some of the footage and laugh out loud! NOTE: This footage will also be a part of the documentary we are making about how people react in fear to things that are not dangerous, ie phobias and unnecessary anxiety. Learn more at www.SwordofPerseusFilms.com
results.name: Fake Snake in the Box Stunt

Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
